loans.name: Mareta

texts.en:
Mareta is from Miasnikyan village of the Armavir region. She has a big family and lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law, 19-year-old and 9-year-old grandsons, and 17-year-old granddaughter. She works in the government sector as an administrative secretary. Her salary, however, is not enough to afford the cost of living. 

With the help of her family members, Mareta is engaged in cattle breeding and in the cultivation of watermelon, alfalfa, apricots, and plums. Her son sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of family's income. To prepare her agribusiness for the winter, Mareta needs to make some investments. She needs a loan of 2,000 USD to purchase forage for cattle. She and her family members rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be very grateful to them for their help in supporting the loan needed to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase forage for cattle.

loans.name: Pajtim

texts.en:
Pajtim wants to thank all the lenders for the previous loan, which helped him to buy new working tools for his business and thereby improve his living standards and ensure income for his family. 

He is still in his business of installing air-conditioners.  Recently he opened a shop for electrical services and repairs, and he is in need of a loan to purchase more equipment for an air conditioner and to buy electrician tools. He hopes in the future to expand his business more and increase his income. 

He wants to thank all of the lenders for the second loan; he appreciates all of the lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more equipment for an air conditioner and to buy electrician tools

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Minh was born in 1980. She lives with her family in Bac Ninh. She has three children. Her oldest child is a carpenter, her youngest child is four years old, and the middle child is in high school. Her husband is a construction worker. Minh retails scrap, to earn a living. She has done this job for four years. Minh is a hard-working and dynamic woman. She also has passion in her business. She said that her job has made her become a dynamic woman, and ensures her family’s life. She earns about 3,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings amount to about 5,000,000 VND per month.

Her challenge in life and work is a lack of capital for her scrap business, and a lack of money to pay for her children’s education. Her dreams are to expand her business, to buy more equipment for her house, and that her children can be successful in life. This loan is one step to help her reach for her dreams. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,528,000 VND, to use in her retail scrap trading. She always wants to expand her business, improve her family’s life, and save profits for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy and sell more scrap.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is 31 years old and married, the father of one child. 

Ali owns a shop for repairing appliances. He established his business in 2000. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

Ali is requesting a loan of USD 2,400 to pay the annual rent for his shop . He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his appliance shop

loans.name: Saad

texts.en:
Saad is from Iraq. He is a youth client of 22 years of age, who is married and lives with his family composed of five members, two of whom are employed.

Saad is a grocer and provides his neighborhood with dairy products, canned food, juices and detergents. He has been in this field since 2005 and has gained much experience in this field. Saad now has an employee hired and is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Saad is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD, which he will use to install a display window for his grocery store. Saad is aiming to grow his business and open a big supermarket one day, so he may provide himself and his family a good income.

loans.use: to install a display window.

loans.name: Mamatkobil

texts.en:
Mamatkobil is 35 years old. He lives in a small village in South Tajikistan with his wife and four children.  

Mamatkobil has been busy with animal husbandry for more than ten years. He feeds sheep as well as cows. His wife has been busy with agricultural activities. They have 0.7 hectare of agricultural land. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. 

He wants to develop a business, but he does not have the money to buy more cattle. This loan will help him to increase the number of cattle and from the profit, improve the family’s living conditions. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Ana Gladys

texts.es:
Ana, reconoce que con la inversión anterior que hizo a su negocio obtuvo clientes muy satisfechos, conto con un inventario muy surtido que le permitió trabajar sin inconvenientes, mejoro su economía, salió de sus deudas.
Comprara hilos, telas, zippers, botones, broches entre otros, con esto trabajara tranquilamente sin preocupaciones de no contar con la materia prima para salir con sus pedidos. Hoy Ana brinda en su casa un apoyo mayor y mas estable.
texts.en: Ana recognizes that the previous investment she made in her business allowed her to satisfy her customers, maintain an assorted inventory so she could work without inconvenience, improve her finances, and pay off her debts.  She will buy thread, fabric, zippers, buttons, snaps, and other items which will enable her to work comfortably without having to worry about not having the materials she needs to fill orders.  Ana is now able to provide more support for her household more consistently.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, zippers, buttons, snaps, etc.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is the age of 39 and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She is the mother of four children; three of them go to school. Her husband has been running a restaurant successfully for many years and handling the financial condition of his house. This restaurant has been cherished by her whole family for many years. 

She has been investing the amount of her previous loans in the current business and has been establishing the restaurant well. She is a long-term member of BRAC Pakistan, and now she is in her sixth loan cycle. Her payment schedule and behavior is so good.

This time, Razia is taking a loan again for the restaurant establishment. In fact, her husband wants to buy fry pans, a cauldron, spoons, plates, chicken, beef, pulses, bread, etc. She is hopeful that taking this loan would be the cause to get more profit and savings as well.

Razia thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase fry pans, a cauldron, spoons, plates, chicken, beef, pulses, and bread for the restaurant of her husband.

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.en:
There is something in life that you start loving in your childhood and it goes through your entire life. For this borrower, this thing is animal husbandry. He was at a young age when his father was raising cattle. That seemed to him very natural. 

Abdusalom is 37 years old, married, and has four children. Also he is a farmer who raises onions. He works hard, but his income is small and it is not enough to buy cattle and increase his working capital. Now he is asking for the loan to increase his working capital.  He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for increasing working capital

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
This is Ma. Luisa. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Ma. Luisa hopes that her business will be more successful and dreams to have a good life. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Juventina

texts.es:
Juventina es una joven con muchas aspiraciones en la vida, muchos sueños y muchas ganas de salir adelante la cual tiene 24 años de edad es una joven casada y madre de un solo hijo el cual estudia en primaria en el centro de educación de la comunidad. Juventina tiene un grado de educación primaria cursado en su totalidad por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero y moral por parte de sus padres. Ella es una mujer muy dinámica y emprendedora la cual gracias a las diferentes capacitaciones que ha recibido y la integración con familiares y amigos ella ha aprendido a la elaboración de pan, artesanía de pino, siembra y cultivo de tomate el cual esta cerca de su casa por lo cual da gracias a Dios por permitirle tanta destreza y una percepción de aprendizaje muy abierta.
Juventina ha solicitado financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de insumos agrícolas para asistir sus cultivos de tomate ya que mediante la aplicación de estos ella podrá mejorar su tomatera evitando la contaminación de bichos entre otros.
Sus planes a futuro son los de poder mejorar sus cosechas implementando un nuevo sistema de riego para mantener saludable y alimentado el producto como también los de seguir cultivando pero en mayores cantidades cubriendo la demanda insatisfecha que actualmente tiene.
texts.en:
Juventina, 24, is a young woman with a lot of goals and dreams in life, and she very much wants to get ahead.  She's married and the mother of an only child who's in elementary school in a school in the community.  Juventina finished elementary school, for which she's grateful to her parents' moral and financial support.

She's a very dynamic and enterprising woman who, thanks to a variety of training and working with friends and relatives, has learned to make bread and pinewood handicrafts.  She grows tomatoes near her house.  She thanks God for her abilities and an open approach to learning.

Juventina has requested a loan from the COMIXMUL cooperative to buy agricultural inputs to take care of her tomato crop.  By applying the inputs she'll be able to improve her tomato plants and avoid pests and other contamination.

Her plans for the future are to be able to improve her harvests with a new irrigation system to keep her crop healthy and nourished.  She also wants to continue farming, but in larger quantities to be able to cover her currently unsatisfied demand.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her tomatoes

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 22-year-old single Palestinian Refugee who has lived and workd in a Palestinian camp in Lebanon since he was born.
Imad has worked as a barber since five years ago. He was only seventeen years old when he started working to help his parents in their living and to cover his needs.
In 2009, he opened his current barber shop, and he is very satisfied with what he achieved until now, but he is working hard on developing and improving his business more and more to increase his income and develop his living.
Imad is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to continue building his future house inside the camp. Imad hopes to move his business outside the camp, so that he can increase his set prices and customers, in addition to providing extra services to his customers.

loans.use: To continue building his own house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son’s university

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Residing in the Ksach Kandal District of Kandal Province, Sitha is 45 years old and widowed. She has one daughter who is still in school. Sitha has struggled to make a living through working as a teacher for 20 years and supplementing the income by farming rice.  She is able to earn about US$10 per day for supporting her daily expenses. 
Sitha has never been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, before. Now she is applying as a third-time borrower with VisionFund to pay for her daughter’s university fees. She hopes that the loan will enable her to keep her daughter in university to pursue her degree so he can find a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s university fees

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
This is Marina, 53, resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Valeriano, who is a worker abroad.  She is also a mother of children. She is managing  their household, while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income to their family.

Marina operates an Internet café business. Services like this become a need, as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who require her services for school assignments. She has customers who need to rent computers for business purposes, too, like writing a resume, or any office documentation. Lastly, she has customers who would just love to surf the net and visit any social network.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in profit, every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a Php40,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy additional computer parts and accessories, which are needed in her business.

Marina hopes to open another branch, and dreams of having a good and long life. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies, which are needed in her business.

loans.name: Bahridin

texts.en:
The borrower has been involved in agriculture for 12 years and grows mainly wheat, maize, carrot, and onion. He lives with his family in his own home. He sells his crops to the grain dealers located near his place of residence. He helps cover family expenses with the profits he earns from sales. When the farming season is over, the borrower does not have another job.

He is requesting a loan to buy farm supplies, such as fertilizer and seeds, to help with cultivation so he can improve his crops and earn more income. His current sales are not enough to cover these expenses, so the loan will help him continue to cover household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Moeu

texts.en:
Moeu is a farmer from Trapeang Khlong village in Baray district, Kampong Thom province. She is 69 years old, a widowed mother for three children, of whom one is single and lives with her, while the other two are married and live independently. 

Moeu is in the agricultural business, primarily growing rice to earn a living for the family. Since the income from agriculture does not provide enough to fulfill her living needs, Moeu is also involved in making and selling Khmer cakes in the region for additional income. The two businesses are important sources of income for the family.

Recently, some parts of Moeu’s house have deteriorated and it needs to be fixed to provide a suitable living for the household. Due to the lack of funds, she has applied for a loan of USD 600 to buy construction materials needed to renovate her house and pay for labor costs. She and her family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them with the loan funded to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy construction materials needed to renovate her house and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is aged 44, and lives with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is married and has six children. Her husband is very hardworking and loves his family very much. He is involved in manufacturing, repairing and selling furniture, such as sofas, beds, chairs, tables and cabinets. This business yields a good income for him, but his family's needs are increasing day by day, and he wants to earn more money.

She has been taking loans for the business of her husband, and she still wants to enhance the business further. This is why she came to BRAC Pakistan. She wishes to obtain a loan to buy raw materials for making furniture, such as planks, chip board, and nails. This time, her husband wants to buy more raw materials for making furniture, in order to expand his business as well. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for the business of her husband and for her family. She says thanks, to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for this financial supporting.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for the furniture shop business of her husband, such as planks, chip board, and nails.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir, a single man, is a hard-working youth from Iraq. He is 24 years old and lives with his family composed of three members, two of whom are employed. Samir is a carpenter and makes all kinds of furniture, according to his customers' requests. He has good experience in this field. He established his business in 2012, and already he has hired an employee. Samir has an excellent reputation in the surrounding area.

Samir is applying for a Youth Loan of 3,000 USD, in order to pay the annual rent of his carpentry shop. Samir is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, in order to provide himself a bright future.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his carpentry shop

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a youth client from Iraq. He is 23 years old, married, and has 2 children. Imad is the sole provider of the family.

Imad owns a small restaurant in his neighborhood, where he sells barbecue sandwiches and drinks. He established his business in 2011 and has an employee. Thanks to the good quality of his food, affordable prices, and polite behavior with his customers, Imad has gained an excellent reputation and is loved by many.

Imad is applying for a youth loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to install a display window and to buy a freezer. Imad is aiming to improve his business and sell more products in order to increase his profits and provide his family with a better income.

loans.use: to install a display window and to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Quy's Group

texts.en:
Quy was born in 1974. She lives with her family in Bac Ninh. She has two sons. One of them is working for the military; the other is a secondary student. 

Her husband is a rice noodle producer. She is a pig raiser. She also helps her husband in his job. She has done this job for 19 years. She earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total income is about 12,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work is lacking capital to buy rice for producing noodles and she has only 5 pigs to raise. Her dream is to have more capital to focus on producing rice noodles. This loan is one of steps to help her reach this dream. 

Quy is a hard working and careful woman. She also has passion in her business. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In this cycle, she would like to borrow 11,872,000 VND to buy rice to produce noodles. She always wants to develop her business, repair her farm, and save profits for her children education.

Other members who are part of Quy’s group include the following:

Canh was born in 1958. She has three children. She sells iron for a living. She wants to borrow 11,872,000 VND to buy chickens for raising. 

Lan was born in 1965. She has two children. She is a vegetable seller. She wants to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy pigs for raising. 

Quy was born in 1973. She has two children. She sells fruit to earn a living. She wants to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy materials for crusting.

Su was born in 1957. She has three children. She raises chickens to earn a living. She wants to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy more chickens for raising. 

Loan was born in 1961. She has three children. She is a vegetable seller. She wants to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy vegetables to sell.

Duong was born in 1977. She has three children. She produces bamboo products to earn a living. She wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to buy chickens for raising.

loans.use: to buy rice to produce noodles.

loans.name: Roberto Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 29 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en La Toma una zona rural de Buenos Aires, que pertenece a Morropon, ubicado en la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno, adicionalmente brinda servicio de transporte a las comunidades aledañas, Manuel ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para comprar repuestos para su vehículo y de esta manera seguir brindando un servicio seguro a sus clientes.
texts.en: Manuel is 29 years old.  He lives with his parents in La Toma, a rural area of Buenos Aires in Morropon province, which is located in the Piura region on the north coast of Peru.  He raises and sells cattle, and also provides transportation services to neighboring communities.  Manuel has requested a loan of 1,000 PEN to buy parts for his vehicle so he can continue to provide a safe taxi service for his clients.

loans.use: to buy parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Kholniso

texts.en:
Kholniso is a strong woman. Her husband died a couple of years ago, and she had to do all the business alone. She is 64 years old, and her kids are already married. Her sons and their wives help her. The business is cattle husbandry, and she has been doing that already for 31 years. So it’s a family business, because they are all involved in it.

She came and asked for the loan to buy cattle, and in this way to increase her working capital. She is more experienced in this business, and she is responsible for all family. This loan will help her to maximize profits and provide better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
This is Celia. She previously accessed an 18,000 PHP loan that she used for purchasing necessary equipment and materials for her hair services. Her earnings were a big help in the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy hair color, a blower, rebonding cream, cellophane, and hair treatment products for her business. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Celia hopes to see her business growing, and she dreams her children will have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for hair color, a blower, rebonding cream, cellophane, and hair treatment products

loans.name: Artashes

texts.en:
Artashes is a private entrepreneur from Armavir city, in Armavir region. He lives with his parents and three brothers (who are 27, 23 and 14 years old). Artashes's father works as a seller in one of the local stores. To take care of his family, Artashes runs a furniture production business. His middle brother works in the same business. The family members work hard, to be able to cover their increasing needs.

To continue running his small business in a sustainable way, Artashes needs to make some investments. He needs a loan of USD 1500, which he will use to purchase necessary materials for furniture production. He has taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to return it back. However, thanks to his hard work during more recent times, Artashes is able to run his business in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The Second-Chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Artashes and his family will be thankful to all the lenders, for helping them to maintain their business.

loans.use: to purchase necessary materials for furniture production

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en:
Hovhannes is an experienced farmer from Dalarik village in the Armavir region. He lives with his wife and son. He works for a private construction company. However, his salary alone is not enough to meet the needs of the family. 

With the help of his family members, Hovhannes breeds calves and pigs, and cultivates sunflowers, grass, and apricots. They sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of income for the family. To be able to effectively meet the increasing needs of his family, Hovhannes wants to expand his agribusiness. A loan of 3,000 USD will be a great support to this hard-working man and his family, enabling them to purchase five steers, fertilizer, and forage for the livestock. 

Hovhannes and his family members rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be grateful to them for supporting the loan needed to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase five steers, fertilizer, and forage for the livestock.

loans.name: Azizjon

texts.en:
Azizjon is a hardworking man who was born in 1983. Azizjon is married and has 2 children. 

He has been growing agricultural products for more than 10 years. He is not the owner of the land he sows; Azizjon rents land for every sowing season. He grows wheat, tomatoes, onions, and carrots. He is the sole provider for his family. His wife does not have her own business, which is why she helps Azizjon with farming agricultural products. 

Azizjon wants to make an autumn sowing, but he does not have enough money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. He is asking for a loan of 2,500 TJS to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is from the Dalarik village of Armavir region. She lives with her husband, and school-age son and daughter (17 and 15 years old). Her husband works as a craftsman, and she works as an administrative secretary in the Children of Armenia Foundation. Both of them work hard to be able to meet ends. 

With the help of her husband, Marine is also engaged in cattle breeding and in the cultivation of wheat and alfalfa. As the family’s needs are growing day by day, Marine wants to expand her agribusiness a little bit to be able to meet her family increasing needs. 

A loan of USD 3,000 will be a great support to this hard-working woman and her family, enabling them to purchase five steers, wheat seeds, and some forage for their cattle and to pay for the harvesting services. 

Marine and her family highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will be very grateful to them for their support in providing the needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase five steers, wheat seeds, and forage for her cattle and to pay for harvesting services

loans.name: Gulshanoy

texts.en:
Mostly people in rural areas are very strong and patient because they had to get used to this bad life conditions and not give up; it makes them stronger.

Gulshanoy is a kind and diligent woman. She is 29 years old. She got married right after finishing the school, and now she has 3 kids. From the time she got married, she started working in farming with her husband. But now her husband left to Russian Federation to earn money because what they have now is not enough. So she is doing the business alone now. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for new autumn season. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the autumn season.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.es:
Bibiana tiene 52 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en el caserío de San Antonio que pertenece a Pucará, conocido por un clima cálido y cultivo de frutales y arroz, a dos horas de la ciudade Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Bibiana se dedica a la compra y venta de productos de granos maíz, menestras, café, cacao y de frutas como lima, naranja, granadillas, papaya, dichos productos los compra en su caserío y para luego llevarlos a otra ciudad donde los comercializa a mayor precio, El ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para comprar productos adicionales que ha tenido en su último pedido.
texts.en:
Bibiana, 52, lives with her husband and children in the San Antonio rural settlement in Pucara.  This place is known for its warm climate and its fruit and rice crops.  It is located 2 hours from the city of Jaen, which is in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

Bibiana has a business buying and selling staple grains, beans, coffee, cocoa, and fruits such as limes, oranges, passion fruit, and papaya.  She buys these products in her settlement, and later takes them to another city to sell at a higher price.  She has requested a loan of 3,000 Peruvian soles to buy additional products that she had in her last order.

loans.use: to buy beans and coffee for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Diu's Group

texts.en:
Diu was born in 1983. She lives with her family in Dong Anh, Hanoi. She has a son and a daughter who are both working in Hanoi. Her husband is a coal retailer. 

Diu sells food and drinks to earn a living. She has done this job for about 10 years.  She earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 12,000,000 VND per month. Her dream is to ensure that her children can have stable jobs. This loan is one of the steps to help her reach this dream. 

Diu is a hard working and careful woman; she also has a passion for her business. She said that this job helps her earn more money to take care of her family and pay for living expenses. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2006. In this cycle, she would like to borrow 10,682,000 VND to sell food. She always wants to expand her business and try to achieve a better life.

Other members in Diu's group include the following:

Chien is 50 years old. She has two children. She raises animals to earn a living. She wants to borrow 10,682,000 VND to buy pigs and chickens. She also wants to buy a sewing machine to sew clothing and earn more money.

Ha is 42 years old. She has a son. She sells food and drinks to earn a living. She wants to borrow 11,554,000 VND to buy machines to make food and drinks to sell.

Thao is 43 years old. She has two children. She has a grocery store. She wants to borrow 11,554,000 VND to buy products to sell in her store.

Giang is 28 years old. She has a child. She has a grocery store. She wants to borrow 9,374,000 VND to buy products to sell in her store.

Phuong is 33 years old. She has a child and is a worker. She wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND to open a transportation business.

loans.use: to sell food.

loans.name: Maria Abraham

texts.es: María Abraham se encuentra muy feliz y muy agradecida con Dios por las oportunidades que diariamente le da para que ella y su familia puedan superarse y salir adelante con cada una de las ideas y actividades emprendidas. Con su primer financiamiento ella pudo comprar los insumos agrícolas que sus cultivos de hortalizas necesitaban para poder tenerlos protegidos y sanos obteniendo de la temporada una excelente cosecha con la cual pago parte de su primer compromiso y logrando bajar su deuda para poder optar a un re financiamiento. Por lo que ella nuevamente solicita un segundo financiamiento con el cual comprara insumos agrícolas para asistir un nuevo cultivo de papas el cual fue cultivado y sembrado con parte de las ganancias de su primera cosecha. de esta manera ella espera ser apoyada por los inversionistas en la plataforma de KIVA ya que sus sueños de seguir extendiendo más sus cultivos de hortalizas cada día que pasa y con esta clase de oportunidades está segura de cumplirlo.
texts.en:
Maria Abraham is very happy and thankful to God for the daily opportunities she is given to get ahead with her family with each of her ideas and enterprising activities.  With her first loan, she was able to buy agricultural supplies that she needed for her vegetable crops, to keep them healthy and protected.  She had an excellent harvest with which she paid off part of her first loan and managed to lower her debt so that she could become eligible for refinancing.

She is requesting a new loan to buy agricultural supplies to tend to a new crop of potatoes that she cultivated and grew with part of the earnings from her first harvest.  In this way, she hopes to be supported by the lenders on the Kiva website, because she dreams of continuing to expand her vegetable plantings each day that passes, and with this type of opportunity she is sure that she will achieve this.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her crops

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.en: A woman nevertheless is the strongest human being on the Earth. During the short period of her life, Dilfuza has shown herself to be a very strong person. She is 22 years old and has one baby now. She got married at a very young age. Her family and her husband’s family are on the average level of life. Her husband was doing a cattle husbandry business and farming, but the money he was earning wasn’t enough and he decided to go to Russia to find some other work. Her husband left and Dilfuza is doing all the businesses in which he was involved. Of course, her family helps her with that. Now, she is asking for a loan to buy more cattle to increase her working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna, age 34, is a housewife. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a beauty salon, which is the only source of income for his family. He has excellent beautician skills, and his customers appreciate his services.

Lubna is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase cosmetic products like lipstick, facial creams, and other products as well as chairs for his salon. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to invest in household needs. 

Lubna hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Ruzikul

texts.en:
Life makes us more flexible and adaptive to tight conditions over a wide range. One day, a man walked into IMON office. His face was kind but unhappy. He asked for a loan officer. Then they started to talk. His name is Ruzikul and he is 49 years old. There are 5 people in his family: him, his wife and 3 kids. 

He told us his story: at the time of World War II, his father got a high extent of disability and stopped working. Ruzikul had to get married and feed all the family. So, that time he started working at the agrobusiness field with his wife. Because of the weather and climate, business was not really good. They lost everything. After that, he decided to go to Russian Federation and work there. When he came back, he was very sored and diseased, and the doctors prohibited him to go abroad and do hard work. He started a new kind of business here; he is a vegetable seller. So now, his elder daughter is getting married and his new business going well. He asked for the loan to replenish his trading capital.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to increase working capital.

loans.name: My

texts.en:
My is from Rolea Bíer district of Kampong Chhnang. She lives with her spouse and five children in her own house. My and her husband are engaged in farming; they have around two-hectare farmland for rice cultivation. Farming is an important source of income for the family. Having been in the business for almost 15 years, she is able to earn a profit of $5 per day.

My currently needs a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to purchase farm supplies, such as fertilizers and diesel for her farming machine. My has already taken four loans from HKL institution before, and she paid off the loans successfully. This loan will enable her to manage agribusiness in a sustainable way. My and her family rely heavily on the goodwill of the lenders, and will be thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies, such as fertilizers and diesel for her farming machine.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en Yambolon una zona rural de Pomahuaca, donde su población se dedica al cultivo de arroz, café, cacao a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, que está ubicado en la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la cría y comercio de ganado vacuno cuenta con invernas propias, además se dedica al cultivo de café, en este último rubro ha tenido inconvenientes porque sus fincas han sido afectadas con la Roya, Cesar ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de ganado vacuno y posteriormente ofrecerlo a un mejor precio y así seguir generando ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar, 36, lives with his wife and children in Yambolon, in a rural area of Pomahuaca.  Here, the residents devote their time to cultivating rice, coffee, and cocoa.  This place is 2 hours from the city of Jaen, which is located in the Cajamarca region of the northern highlands of Peru.

Cesar raises and sells cattle.  He also has a nursery and grows coffee.  In this second line of work, he's had some difficulties because his farms have been affected by the Roya fungus.  

Cesar is requesting a loan of 2,500 Peruvian soles to buy cattle that he will later sell at a better price.  This way, he can continue to generate income for his family.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Kareema

texts.en:
Kareema is a married woman from Iraq. She is 50 years old and has three children. Kareema and her children take part in providing the family living.
Kareema is a tailor and she works from her house. She specializes in sewing all types of women's outfits. She has been sewing for a living since 2007 and has gained much experience in this field. She has a good reputation in the neighborhood and is respected by many.

Kareema is requesting a loan of 1,800 USD to buy a motor generator and a new air-conditioner. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits so she may continue providing her house with all the basic needs.

loans.use: to buy a motor generator and a new air-conditioner

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is an experienced agronomist from Dashtavan village in the Armavir region. She lives with her husband, daughter, and son. The latter is a contractual serviceman. 

To take care of her family's needs, Marine cultivates grass and breeds cows and pigs. Her family members sell the agricultural products in the local market. As life is getting more expensive day by day, Marine needs to expand her agribusiness to be able to meet their needs. The barn for the livestock is in poor condition and needs to be renovated. She needs a loan of 1,300 USD to purchase a pig, renovate the barn, and buy some cellophane for building a greenhouse. 

Marine and her family members rely on the goodwill of the lenders and are thankful to them for their help in supporting the loan needed to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase a pig, renovate the barn, and buy some cellophane for building a greenhouse.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is a single mother of five children, and all of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister and her daughter and a cousin). She has a business of a beauty salon, and has been in this business for 11 years. She generates additional income through selling used clothes. She works in a shop and sells on a retail basis only, seven days out of every week. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of cream relaxers in Uganda. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked beauty salon and build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids, weaves, and other cosmetics.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene tiene 37 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en Chumbenique una zona rural del distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica al cultivo de arroz, algodón a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella tiene una bodega, vende todo tipo de abarrotes arroz, leche, menestras y verduras, su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, además se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, Irene ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para adquirir en mayor cantidad de abarrotes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Irene, 37, lives with her son in Chumbenique, a rural area in the district of Oyotun.  The people here grow rice and cotton.  This place is located 2 hours from the city of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region of the northern coast of Peru.

Irene has a store where she sells all types of groceries, including rice, milk, beans, and vegetables.  Her business is located in her home.  In addition, she raises and sells barnyard animals.  Irene has requested a loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles to buy groceries in bulk.  This way, she can generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her store

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is an experienced agronomist from Baghramyan village in the Armavir region.  She lives with her husband and two sons. Emma's eldest son is a contractual serviceman in the military service. For more than 15 years, Emma and her family members have been engaged in agribusiness. They breed livestock of pigs, piglets, and hens and cultivate apricot and grapes. Emma's husband and sons realize the agricultural products in the local market, which is the most important source of family's income. To run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Emma needs a loan of USD 1,500 to prepare the vineyard for winter and to renovate the greenhouse. As this is Emma’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. Emma and her family will be very thankful to the lenders for the good will and will highly appreciate their support.

loans.use: to prepare the vineyard for winter and to renovate the greenhouse

loans.name: Hameedan

texts.en:
Hameedan is 54 years old and lives with her spouse and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
Her husband is a milkman by profession. He sells milk in the market. He wants to buy a refrigerator for the preservation of unsold milk but he does not have funds to do so. Therefore, Hameedan requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband will be able to buy a refrigerator for the preservation of milk.
 
She is very happy after taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her husband's milk shop

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Martha de 47 años de edad, madre soltera con un hijo menor de edad. Es originaria de  Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de su pequeño hijo y pasar tiempo de calidad. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gatos del hogar. Y por lo tanto lucha día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a su pequeño hijo.
Gracias a sus esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles  en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergente, jugos, gaseosas, fósforos, tiste, verduras. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestible para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Martha agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Martha is 47 years old and a single mother of a young boy. She is a native of Leon, which is in the western part of the country. Martha is described as a hard-working and responsible person who wants to better herself. She says that she likes to spend quality time with her young son when she is not working. 

Sadly, Martha did not have enough money to go to school, and she had to go to work at a young age to help with the family expenses. She continues to work hard day after day to give her son a better future. Thanks to a lot of effort and her strong desire to get ahead, Martha has her own business, which is a small grocery store. She sells small quantities of daily use items such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, juice, soft drinks, matches, vegetables and tiste [a cornmeal and cacao-based drink]. Martha spends twelve hours each day working at her business and offering her products. She says she enjoys this work very much. 

Martha is requesting this loan to invest in working capital and to stock her grocery store with daily use items. She hopes to improve her income in the near future. Martha is grateful to Kiva lenders for the help they give to people with limited resources in developing countries like Nicaragua so that they can improve their incomes.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store with daily use items such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, juice, soft drinks, matches, vegetables and tiste [a cornmeal and cacao-based drink].

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Ry is 25 years old and married, raising five children with her husband in Baray, Kampong Thom province. She started farming at a young age with rice and cassava cultivation and now that is the only source of income for the family. With support from her husband and children, Ry is able to earn approximately KHR 32,000 per day. She aims to increase her farming area and improve her productivity. To make her dreams a reality, she has applied for a loan of KHR 2,500,000 to buy a plot of farmland. This will be a great opportunity for her to finance the purchase of land to increase her farming productivity. She hopes to have better yields and boost her income. Ry and her family rely heavily on the good will of the lenders and will be thankful for their support.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of hair cream and extensions, thus aiding her to better serve her customers.

loans.name: Vun

texts.en: From Siem Reap province, Vun is 31 old years and a domestic farmer who owns and manages a few pieces of land for rice cultivation. With the support of her husband, she is able to make a decent income to support her daily living costs. She also has other source of income from her husband, who generates his income from a fishing business. The couple has two children who depend on their care. With the loan, Vun will buy fertilizers to maintain her rice crops in good condition and purchase a fishing boat for her husband. She hopes this investment will bring her a better yield and boost her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her daughter's school fees

loans.name: Edwin Gonzalo

texts.es:
Edwin es un joven de 34 años que nació en La Paz – Bolivia, es Ingeniero Agrónomo de Profesión, titulado en la Universidad Mayor de San Andrés; actualmente trabaja como Técnico en el Servicio Nacional de Sanidad Agropecuaria e Inocuidad Alimentaria de la ciudad de La Paz.  Ha solicitado un crédito para cursar la Maestría en Evaluación Ambiental.
Sueña con habitar un país donde se pueda vivir con desarrollo sostenible pero por sobre todo sin contaminación, pues cree que es lo más importante que se puede heredar a nuestros hijos, es por este motivo que decidió continuar estudiando en el área medioambiental, pues sostiene que mediante el programa de estudios que está cursando podrá adquirir mayores conocimientos para buscar soluciones técnicas a los diferentes problemas del medio ambiente y de contaminación, ya que a nivel nacional no existen muchos expertos en esta área y que conforme pasa el tiempo y la tecnología avanza, nuestros recursos naturales desaparecen, menciona que uno de los pasos más importantes es concientizar a nuestras familias y orientar a nuestros hermanos e hijos al respecto.
Agradece a las personas que están haciendo posible que cuente con recursos para seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Edwin is a 34-year-old young man who was born in La Paz, Bolivia. He is an agricultural engineer and has a degree from the Universidad Mayor de San Andrés. He currently works as a Technician in the Agricultural Health and Food Safety Service in La Paz.

He has requested a loan to enroll in a Master's degree program in Environmental Assessment. He dreams of living in a country where there is sustainable development without pollution. He believes that this is the most important thing that we can leave behind for our children. This is why he has decided to continue his education in the field of environmental studies. Through the program that he will enroll in, he will acquire greater knowledge to look for technical solutions to different environmental and pollution problems. Nationally, there are not many experts in this area and, while time goes on and technology advances, our national resources are disappearing.

Edwin mentions that one of the most important steps we can take is to make our family aware of the issues and guide our brothers and children on this subject. He thanks the people who are making it possible for him to have the resources to continue studying.

loans.use: to enroll in a Master's degree program in Environmental Assessment.

loans.name: Selva Tatiana

texts.es:
Tatiana es una joven de 26 años de edad,  vive en la zona sur de la ciudad de Cochabamba, zona  con restricciones en cuanto al acceso a todos los servicios básicos.
Ella es la mayor de cuatro hermanos, su mamá los crió sola debido a que su padre los abandono cuando su último hermano no había nacido. La madre de Tatiana es enfermera, por lo que tiene turnos de trabajo bastante sacrificados.
Para poder apoyar a su familia y tener mayores oportunidades de superación, entró a estudiar administración de empresas a una universidad privada, pero por falta de dinero tuvo que abandonar la carrera.
Trabaja como administradora de un café Internet, su salario apenas le alcanza para los gastos de su casa.
En la actualidad estudia la carrera de Técnico Superior en Banca, está solicitando un crédito para poder terminar estos estudios. Ella ya recibió ofertas de trabajo de bancos, pero el principal obstáculo para contratarla es la falta de un título académico, al tenerlo podrá mejor sus ingresos económicos y ayudar en la estabilidad económica de sus hermanos menores y su madre.
texts.en:
Tatiana is a young woman of 26. She lives in the southern zone of the city of Cochabamba, a zone with restrictions in terms of access to all basic services. She is the oldest of four siblings. Her mother raised them while single, given that their father abandoned them when her last brother was not born. Tatiana's mother is a nurse; therefore she has work shifts that are fairly sacrificing. 

To be able to help her family and have better opportunities to get ahead, she entered to study business administration in a private university, but for lack of money she had to abandon her degree. She works as the manager of an internet café, her salary barely covers the costs of her home.

Currently, she is studying the Superior Technical degree of Banking. She is applying for a loan to be able to finish her studies. She has already received work offers from banks, but the main obstacle for hiring her is the lack of an academic degree. When she obtains it she will be able to improve her economic income and help with the economic instability of her younger siblings and her mother.

loans.use: to finish her studies in the Superior Technical program in Banking

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his home.

loans.name: Umry

texts.en: Umry is a first cycle borrower with IMON. She is 58 year old. She is married and has three children. She worked more than 30 years in a school. Now, she is a pensioner. She has been busy with animal husbandry. She feeds cows. Her husband helps her with the business. Her son works in Russia. Umry has a problem in her family. Her daughter-in-law is ill. She learned about the illness of her daughter-in-law two weeks ago. She worries about her health. Umry does not have enough money to buy medicine to treat her daughter-in-low. She is asking for a loan of 550 Somoni. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy medicine to treat her daughter-in-law

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is married with four children and two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a business selling green bananas. She works in the market six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenge includes seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and to start going to the villages of Masaka for green bananas.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is a single mother of 4 children, and two of her children go to school. She has a business of a bar, and has been in this business for 3 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,800,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more crates of beer, soda, and jerrycans of local Gin.

She works in a shop seven days out of every week, and sells on retail basis only. She generates additional income through selling piped water. Her major business challenges are the seasonality and thieves. 

She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked pub and becoming a wholesaler. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer, soda, and jerrycans of local Gin.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is married with two children, one of whom goes to school.  She also takes care of her mother.  She has a business of a retail shop and has been in this for two years. She generates additional income through farming.  

Prossy has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.  

She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked shop and also to build her own house.  She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more jerrycans of cooking oil, boxes of soap, cartons of salt and bags of sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of plastic containers, thus improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of buckets and pots.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem, age 51, is a local villager in Bakan district in Pursat province. She has been working in the farming business for 34 years with her husband. She is able to earn an income of KHR 24,000 each day. With this little income, she is usually supporting the whole family’s basic needs, such as food, education, and other commodity costs. She has given birth to six children, four of whom are under her care.

During this period, Sem’s living conditions are not comfortable as she doesn't have a safe latrine for the household, so she decided to apply for a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to buy construction materials needed to build a latrine. 

Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL and Kiva with a special interest rate, she is encouraged to focus on a healthy living conditions, safeguard the health of her family, and protect the environment.

loans.use: to buy construction materials needed to build a latrine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of fabric, needles, and thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more handbags for resale.

loans.name: Araqsi

texts.en: Araqsi lives with her husband in Masis town. Last year, Araqsi started to provide designing services to locals. She makes table designs for different ceremonies such as birthdays, weddings, and baptisms. Due to Araqsi's hard work, customers value her work much. Together with her designing service, Araqsi is working at a local kindergarten as a tutor. The income that she gets is very important to cover her family's basic costs. Now, because of difficult financial conditions, Araqsi isn't able to purchase materials to provide designs for new orders that she currently has. Araqsi is asking for this loan and has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Araqsi and she will be very grateful to all lenders.

loans.use: to pay for needed materials to make table decorations

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory, allowing her to sell greater quantities of fabric.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 22-year-old married Palestinian refugee, living and working in a Palestinian camp in Lebanon.

Just like almost all of the Palestinians living in Lebanon, Jihad has a limited access to several working domains and sectors. Jihad has been working in construction since four years ago. He specializes in pasting floor tiles. His uncle provided him with the necessary experience to move forward with his domain.
 
He used to work as a nurse, but his low income forced him to move forward towards starting his own business, which he works hard to develop and improve. 

He is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to buy new tools and machines necessary for developing his business. He will buy a power engine and a special tiles' cutting machine to make his work easier and faster.
   
Jihad hopes to keep on expanding his business more and more to provide his family with a better living.

loans.use: to buy new tools (power engine and a special tiles' cutting machine) necessary for his business.

loans.name: Bejan

texts.en:
Bejan lives in Vanadzor town with his wife and two little daughters (ages 8 and 5). Bejan has been earning his family's living by providing a construction service for six years already. As the only breadwinner of the family, Bejan works hard to sustain his family's living and provide appropriate conditions for them.

Now, Bejan is asking for this loan to be able to purchase tools and materials needed for providing the construction service. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan will greatly assist Bejan to continue his construction business and gather income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials needed for providing his construction service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair a truck to transport coffee, and to hire coffee pickers.

loans.name: Santos Marcial

texts.es:
Santos Marcial tiene 51 años de edad, vive en Oyotun sin hijos dependientes, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, ubicado en la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Marcial se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, adicionalmente se dedica a las labores agrícolas, El ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para mejorar la infraestructura de los corrales que ocupan sus animales y de esta manera mejorar su distribución teniendo una alta producción.
texts.en:
Santos Marcial, age 51, lives in Oyotun without dependent children.  It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo.  It is located in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

Marcial raises and sells barnyard animals.  His business is located in the area behind his house.  He also does agricultural work.

He has requested a loan for 1,000 soles in order to improve the infrastructure of the corals where he keeps his animals.  This way he will improve his distribution and have high production.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure of the corals where he raises his animals.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 62 años de edad, es una mujer muy alegre, emprendedora y dinámica.  Es viuda desde hace ya varios años, vive en su casa propia con su hijo mayor, su nuera y su nieto, a los cuales quiere mucho. El negocio que realiza Nelly es la venta de respuestos de motos y mototaxi, para esto tiene un espacio acondicionado en su propia casa.  Ha esta actividad se dedica  desde hace más de 25 años, el cual inició con su difunto esposo, tiempo en el cual le ha valido para hacerse conocida, siendo su tienda una de las más concurridas de la localidad, cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo y su nuera para la atención al público, además de un ayudante para los trabajos pesados de carga de cajas, al cual paga  semanalmente. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene y las  buenas ganancias que le deja. Este es su quinto préstamo con Kiva se siente muy contenta y agradecida con el apoyo que viene recibiendo, para lo cual se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el cantidad prestada de 3000 nuevos soles comprará repuestos de motos y mototaxi al por mayor, mayor cantidad a menos costos para tener mayor margen de ganancias.
texts.en:
Nelly, age 62, is a very happy, enterprising, and dynamic woman.  She has been a widow for several years.  She lives in her own house with her oldest son, her daughter-in-law, and her grandson, all of whom she loves very much.

Nelly’s business is selling motorcycle and mototaxi replacement parts.  In order to do this, she has a space set up in her own house.  She has been engaged in this business activity for over 25 years.  She started with her deceased husband.  Her time in the business has made her well-known, as her store is one of the busiest in the area.

Her son and her daughter-in-law help her wait on the public.  She also has a helper for the heavy jobs of carrying boxes, and she pays him weekly.  She believes that her business is quite profitable because of the demand that she has and the good profits it gives her.

This is her fifth loan with Kiva.  She is very happy and grateful for the support she has been receiving.  She pledges to be punctual with her payments.  She will use the requested 3,000 soles to buy replacement parts for motorcycles and mototaxis wholesale.  She will buy a greater quantity at a lesser cost in order to have a greater profit margin.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts wholesale.

loans.name: Abdukayum

texts.en:
He is what people usually call a man's man. Abdukayum is a 30-year-old man. He was raised in a poor family, and from his childhood, he was helping his parents. After finishing school, he got married. He was the one who supports, feeds, and takes care of his parents and the whole family. He prepared and provided the wedding party for his younger brother too. 

Now he is foreman; he builds and reconstructs houses. He has 5 kids. That’s why he needs to overhaul his house. His house is in bad condition. He is asking for a loan of 7,500 TJS to buy building materials for repairing house. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials for repairing his house.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una mujer de 41 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus 2 pequeños hijos, ella es madres soltera, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Elizabeth no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Elizabeth trabaja como mesera en un restaurante de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Elizabeth se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizara el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea tarrajear y pintar las habitaciones de sus hijos, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una vivienda segura y adecuada para su familia.
texts.en:
Eelizabeth is 41 years old, she lives in the city of Ica and she is a very hardworking single mother of two children. She dedicates all of her efforts towards getting her family ahead in life. 

Due to lack of financial resources and the need to work, Elizabeth was not able to study to pursue a professional career. She works as a waitress in a restaurant in her city, and works shifts of about 10 hours every day. Things are going well at work thanks to her dedication and her efforts.

Elizabeth is very thankful to Kiva Lenders, as she will be able to improve her home by plastering and painting the walls of her children’s bedrooms. She will continue to work and dedicate her efforts towards achieving her dream of owning a safe and suitable home for her family.

loans.use: to improve her home.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana, a 28-year-old single mother supporting two children, 10 and 6 years old, has been operating an M-pesa (mobile-phone based money transfer) shop for one year. Located in Mpeketoni, her business earns her a monthly income of ksh.10,000. 

Introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer, Susana is taking her first loan of ksh.20,000 to add more float to her business. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Susana's hopes for the future are to grow her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To add more float to her business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 30 years old, a female and married. She has five children 16,13,11,8 and 6 years old respectively, all of whom she supports.  She has been running a grocery business over the last two years, which is located at Kibaoni.  In her business she earns a monthly income of ksh.8,000.  Agnes was introduced to KADET by an officer and she is taking her first loan of ksh.10,000.  She intends to use the loan to add inventory to her grocery business, buying tomatoes, potatoes, brinjals, peppers and cabbages. Agnes will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family, are to educate her children and have a bigger business.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, potatoes, brinjals, peppers and cabbage.

loans.name: Liliam Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny tiene 29 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en El Pedregal una zona rural del Distrito de Buenos Aires, que pertenece a Morropon, ubicado en la Región de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su familia se dedican a la venta de fruta en los caseríos aledaños, Marleny ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para comprar abarrotes para una pequeña bodega que piensa colocar en su domicilio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Marleny is 29 years old and lives with her family in El Pedregal, which is a rural area of the district of Buenos Aires in the province of Morropon. This province is part of the larger Piura region along the northern coast of Peru. 

Together with her family, Marleny works selling fruit in the nearby villages. She is requesting this loan for 1,000 PEN to buy groceries for a small store that she is planning to open in her home in order to improve her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as milk, rice and vegetables for her store.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has no electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail selling business for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbors and passerby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase sacks of rice, wheat flour and sugar for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, wheat flour and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Elena Hermida

texts.es:
Elena Hermida tiene 47 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el caserío Pan de Azúcar una zona rural de Oyotun, donde su población se dedica al comercio de aves de corral, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Con la ayuda de sus hijos se dedican a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, para contribuir con los ingresos para su familia, Ella ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 300 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados para los mismos y de esta manera ofrecerlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Elena Hermida is 47, and lives with her family in the hamlet of Pan de Azúcar, in the rural area of Oyotun, two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru. Its inhabitants make a living in the poultry business.

With the help of her children, she works raising and selling farmyard animals, to contribute to the family income. She has requested a loan of 1,300 soles to buy animal feed for them, so that she can sell them to her customers for a better price, generating greater profits.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add extra stocks of flour and rice to her retail shop.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is from Ghukasavan village which is in the Ararat region of Armenia.  He lives there with his parents and brother. Two years ago Arman started his manufacturing business. He makes different types of furniture and sells them to local people. Due to his high quality work, the furniture that he makes is much demanded among the locals.

Now, because of a lack of financial resources, Arman isn't able to satisfy the current demand of his customers. So by applying for this loan Arman asks for financial help to purchase a new stock of tools and materials. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for this young and enthusiastic man to be able to continue his business and gather more income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of tools and materials to provide a manufacturing service.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 50 años de edad, vive en el Distrito de Lagunas, una comunidad que se caracteriza por el cultivo de plantas medicinales, a una hora y treinta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El es conocido en el medio por su labor de venta de productos medicinales, su hijo le ayuda en las ventas, Oscar ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para comprar maca y algarrobina, ya que estos productos son los más solicitados por sus clientes, con el crédito otorgado generara ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar, age 50, lives in the Langunas district.  His community is known for growing medicinal plants.  It is one hour and thirty minutes from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

He is known in the field for his work selling medicinal products.  His son helps him with the sales.

Oscar has requested a loan for 1,500 soles to buy ‘maca’ [Peruvian ginseng] and carob flavoring.  These are the products that are most requested by his customers.  With the loan he was granted he will generate additional income for his family.

loans.use: to buy ‘maca’ [Peruvian ginseng] and carob flavoring.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is from Vanadzor town and lives with her twin daughters. Her husband has migrated to Russia as a labour migrant in order to work there.  He sends some money home to the family to take care of their needs. To tackle financial hardships, Gohar has been involved in the retail business for many years. She sells perfumes to local people from her house and in this way earns income to cover her family's daily costs.
 
Gohar is currently asking for this loan to purchase a new stock of perfumes to resell to her customers. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to traditional credit products. This loan is very important for Gohar and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for perfumes to resell to customers.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a fifty-one-year-old, married father of four children, who has worked in the flower selling business for thirty five years.  In January 2000, he started his own business to improve his living and respond better to his family's needs and requests.

In addition to selling flowers, Mohamad works with a wedding planner to decorate weddings and special events with special themes and designs. To keep on developing his business, Mohamad is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to increase his business merchandise with special Christmas flowers and decorating items to be ready for this upcoming holy occasion.

Mohamad enjoys his business a lot and he is working hard to develop and open another branch of his business in the future.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with special Christmas flowers and decorating items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her existing footwear capacity.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school, and are still under her care. They live at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Esther operates a clothes selling business. She sells at the market to her town-dwellers and her neighbors. She cites her major challenge to be the rate of competition. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase 2 bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 2 bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Gladyness

texts.en:
Gladyness is a married woman with four children, all of whom still attend school. They live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her kids.

Gladyness operates a clothes selling business.  She sells at the market to her town dwellers and her neighbors. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase 3 bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María Elena tiene 57 años de edad vive junto a su familia en Cayalti, su población se dedica al cultivo de caña, arroz y a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella es conocida por su labor en la venta de alfañique (pasta de azúcar estirada y retorcida en barras delgadas) de esta manera María Elena contribuye con su esposo generando ingresos para su familia, Ella ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para comprar insumos para su negocio azúcar, colorantes y moldes para así seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is 57 years old and she lives with her family in Cayalti, a place two hours away from the city of Chiclayo in the northern coast of Peru, where the population works mostly in the production of sugar cane and rice.

Maria Elena is well known for selling “alfañique” (a sugar paste which is stretched and twisted into thin strips). This is how she helps her husband with the family income. 

She is requesting a loan of 2000 nuevos soles to buy ingredients for her business -like sugar, food coloring and baking molds- in order to continue to work.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, food coloring and baking molds.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Doña Dominga de 66 años, no estudio, es casada; su esposo se dedica a cultivar maíz, frijol y tule, sus tres  hijos ya no viven con ella.

Ella cultiva tule,  del cual elabora petates, trabajo que heredo de sus padres desde pequeña,  solo vive de la venta de petates y la agricultura, este trabajo lo hace al terminar los quehaceres del hogar. 

El crédito lo necesita, para pagar mano de obra,  para que le limpien el cultivo de tule, con el objetivo de obtener mejor cosecha.
