Doña Norma es una señora muy luchadora de 42 años de edad, casada y madre de 4 hijos los cuales se involucran en las diferentes actividades que a diario se realizan en el campo como la limpieza, riego de agua, aplicación de abono, foliares, fertilizantes, entre otros. Su nivel educativo primario completa la cual pudo cursar gracias al apoyo económico y moral por parte de sus padres. Doña Norma desde hace 6 años se dedica junto a su esposo a la agricultura al cultivo de hortalizas y frijol siendo el quien le enseñara a trabajar la tierra y contando con su propio terreno que se encuentra cerca de su casa de habitación por lo que día con día junto a su esposo y sus hijo trabajan arduamente y a la vez con mucho entusiasmo cuidan y limpian sus cultivos con la convicción que obtendrán una excelente cosecha. 
Por lo que hoy en día ella se ve en la necesidad de solicitar financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas y semilla de papa certificada la cual será cultivada y asistida con la compra de insumos ya que gracias a este apoyo ella podrá mejorar sus cultivos incrementando más su cosecha y mejorando el volumen al final de la temporada.
Ella sueña en un futuro hacer crecer sus cultivos sembrando y cultivando mayor cantidad de hortalizas y de esta forma obtener mayores ingresos que le permitan salir adelante con su familia y brindarle una mejor oportunidad de vida a sus hijos, educarlos de forma que ellos en un futuro sean personas preparadas y visionarios que cuiden el patrimonio que ella desea heredarles.
texts.en:
Norma is a fighting lady of 42 years of age. She is married and the mother of 4 children who are involved in various daily activities performed in the fields such as cleaning, water irrigation, compost applications, foliar fertilizing, among others. She was able to complete her primary school education thanks to the financial and moral support of her parents. Norma has been working with her husband for 6 years in agriculture growing vegetables and beans. He taught her to work the land and their own land is located near the house where they live. Day after day with her husband and son, working hard but at the same time with a lot of enthusiasm, they care for and clean their crops with the belief that they will have an excellent harvest.

So today she has seen the need to ask for financing in order to buy the agricultural supplies and certified potato seeds which will be grown and assisted by the purchase of supplies and thanks to the help she will be able to improve her crops, increasing her harvest and improving the volume at the end of the season.

She dreams of a future growing her crops, planting and cultivating more vegetables so that she can obtain higher earnings permitting her and her family to get ahead and offering a better opportunity of life to her children, educating them so that they are prepared for the future and are visionaries who care for the heritage she wants to bequeath them.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and certified potato seeds to grow.

loans.name: Sergio Franklin

texts.en:
Becoming an accountant is Sergio's dream. Sergio was accepted into INCOS, and now with the chance to achieve his dream, is concerned about affording tuition fees. He plans on graduating in December 2013, but without a loan from Vittana, he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. 

Sergio plans on using the loan to cover the cost of his graduation fees. Often, there are fees for earning your title in accounting before graduating. 

In addition to his responsibilities at school, Sergio currently works 30 hours a week and earns $17 a day. With a career in accounting, he expects to earn $25 a day. As the youngest, with one older sibling attending college already, Sergio is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana dreams of becoming an international trade manager, but without a degree, she knows it may never be possible. Ana was accepted into the Universidad Tecnologica Boliviana, and now with the chance to achieve her dream, she is concerned about affording tuition fees. 

With this loan, Ana plans to pay her graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in La Paz. 

Ana currently works 30 hours a week, but making time to work and go to school has been one of her biggest challenges. With a career in international trade management, she expects to earn $20 a day, a substantial increase from before. 

Ana's parents were never able to complete their primary education. For her family of six, finances have always been tight. As the youngest of four, with one older sibling attending college already, Ana is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan. Ana's father's salary from his job as a carpenter is the family's primary source of income.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Milenka

texts.es:
Milenka,es soltera y no tiene hijos,vive en la casa de su padre ocupando solo una habitación con paredes de ladrillo,la casa se encuentra en la población de Palomar en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente se dedica por completo a la agricultura,ya que termino la secundaria y aun no entro a estudiar a la universidad; a pesar de su corta edad sabe mucho de agricultura y engorde de ganado,ella debe apoyar a su padre en la parte económica ya que solo vive con el,debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos,es por eso que solicita el crédito ya que desea comprar semilla mejorada, para facilitar su producción ya que le ahorrará mucho tiempo por que no necesita de tanto riego, además de ser una producción más limpia y sin dañar el medio ambiente.
El sueño de Milenka es estudiar agronomia ya que sabe mucho del área rural.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y también con KIVA.
texts.en:
Milenka is single and has no children. She lives in her father's home, which has only one room and has brick walls. The home is located in the village of Palomar in the city of La Paz.
She currently works full time in agriculture. She finished high school and has not gone on to university yet. Despite her young age she knows a great deal about agriculture and livestock. She has to help her father with the finances because they live alone together. She has to cover their food costs and basic bills. For this reason, she is requesting this loan. She wants to buy improved seed in order to facilitate production. This will save her a lot of time because the crops will not need as much water. The production will be more clean and will not damage the environment.
This is the first time that she is requesting a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy improved seeds for facilitating prooduction.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raul, es casado y tiene dos hijos que son independientes,viven en casa propia ocupando solo una habitación, con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra en la población de Palomar en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como agricultor por mas de diez horas al día ya que es el único ingreso que tiene para mantener a su familia,su esposa le ayuda pero ambos son de la tercera edad y con los ingresos que tienen deben cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo solicitan para la compra de semilla mejorada ya que les ahorra mucho trabajo por que no requiere de mucho riego y la producción es en menos tiempo y es mucho más sana y no perjudica al medio ambiente.
El sueño de Raul,es comprar mas terrenos para mejorar sus ingresos y posteriormente dedicarse al engorde de ganado.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y también con KIVA.
texts.en:
Raul is married and has two adult children. He lives in a one-room home with brick walls and a dirt floor. His home is located in Palomar, in the city of La Paz. 

He currently works as a farmer for more than 10 hours each day. His income supports his family. His wife helps him, but they are both elderly. Their income goes to paying for food and basic services.

Raul will use the loan to purchase better seeds that will save them a lot of work because they do not require much irrigation, they can be harvested in a shorter amount of time, and they do not harm the environment. 

Raul's dream is to purchase more land to increase his income and, later, make a living by raising cattle. This is his first loan with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to purchase better seeds that will produce a higher quality product that can be harvested cleanly and will not harm the environment.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, es casado y tiene tres hijos los cuales todos son independientes, vive en casa propia ocupando tres habitaciones con pisos de tierra, la casa se encuentra en la población del Palomar en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente se dedica a la agricultura y al engorde de ganado por mas de diez horas al día ya que es el único que cubre los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de semilla mejorada ya que le es de mucha ayuda por que la producción es en menos tiempo, con mejor calidad y no requiere de mucho riego lo cual ayuda para el no desperdicio de agua y mejora del medio ambiente natural. En el tiempo que le queda se dedica al ganado de crías de toros.
El sueño de Juan es aumentar su producción y también su ganado para mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida ya que desea ahorrar para su vejez y contar con mas ingresos posteriormente ya que es el único que aporta económicamente.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito en IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Juan is married and has 3 children; all of whom are independent. He lives in his own 3-bedroom house which has earthen floors, in the Palomar neighbourhood in La Paz. He currently works in agriculture and raising livestock, working more than 10 hours a day, since it is the only source of income he has to cover food and basic services for his family.

Juan needs a loan to buy better seed, since it will help to reduce the production time, and result in better quality produce. Also, it does not require much watering, which will help him save water and improve the natural environment. In the remaining time, Juan also raises calves.

Juan's dream is to increase his production and also his livestock so he can increase his income and his quality of life. He wants to save for his old age and he wants to increase his earnings for the future as it is his only source of income.

This is the second time Juan has taken a loan with IMPRO and the first with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy improved seeds

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio,es soltero y tiene un hijo el cual ya es independiente,vive en la población Palomar de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene casa propia y ocupa solo una habitación con paredes de ladrillo.
Actualmente trabaja por mas de ocho horas al día dedicándose por completo a la agricultura,ya que es el único ingreso que tiene con el cual debe cubrir sus gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo necesita para la compra de semilla mejorada ya que le sera de mucha ayuda por que la producción es mas rápida y no requiere de mucho riego, además de tener mejor calidad ahorrando en agua que es un elemento escencial para cuidar el medio ambiente natural de la región.
El sueño de Emilio es comprarse mas terrenos para aumentar su producción y también dedicarse mas tiempo al engorde de ganado.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y también con KIVA.
texts.en:
Emilio is single and has a grown son. He lives in the Palomar neighborhood of La Paz, in his own home, in which he occupies a single room with brick walls. 

He currently works more than 8 hours a day, dedicating himself completely to his agricultural activities as this is the only source of income he has to cover his living expenses. 

The loan that he is asking for is to purchase improved seeds, which will allow him to grow his crops more quickly and without having to water them as much. This will allow him to save water, which is an essential natural resource for his region. He hopes that this way he will be able to protect the environment. 

Emilio's dream is to buy more land so he can increase his production and also dedicate himself to raising livestock. This is the first loan he is asking for from IMPRO and from KIVA.

loans.use: to buy seeds that have been modified to grow quickly and with less water, in order to help protect the environment

loans.name: Mena

texts.es:
Mena es casada y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar,viven en casa propia ocupando dos habitaciones con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la población del Palomar de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente se dedica a la agricultura durante todo el día,ya que es la única que aporta para los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia,ya que su esposo se fue al interior del país y llega  cada dos o tres meses.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de semilla mejorada ya que le sera de mucha ayuda por que le ahorrara mucho tiempo y la producción sera mas rápida con menos riego, ahorrando agua y así contribuye al mantenimiento de un medio ambiente natural.
El sueño de Mena,es mejorar sus ingresos y también dedicarse por mas tiempo al engorde de ganado y comprar mas terrenos para ser mas rentable ya que es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y también con KIVA.
texts.en:
Mena is married and has 2 children who are in school. They live in their own 2-bedroom home with brick walls and earthen floor, in the Palomar neigbourhood in the city of La Paz. Mena currently works in agriculture all day as it is her only source of income to pay for food, education and basic services for her family. Her husband went into the middle of the country and comes back every 2 - 3 months.

Mena wants to invest the loan in buying improved seed, since it will help her to save time, and production will be faster with less irrigation. This will save water and so contribute to the maintenance of the natural environment.

Mena's dream is to increase her income and also spend more time raising livestock and buying more land so that the business is more profitable, as it is her only source of income.

This is the first loan Mena has taken with IMPRO and also with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy improved seeds.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina, es viuda y tiene dos hijos los cuales ya son independientes, vive sola en casa  propia ocupando dos habitaciones con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra,la casa se encuentra ubicada en la población de palomar en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente se dedica a la agricultura por completo ya que es la única que cubre sus ingresos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos ya que ninguno de sus hijos le ayuda económicamente siendo ella de la tercera edad.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de semilla mejorada ya que le sera de mucha ayuda  por que no necesita de mucho riego y su producción es en menos tiempo y además de mejor calidad respetando el medio ambiente.
El sueño de Valentina es comprar ganado para dedicarse al engorde y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y también la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Valentina is a widow with two grown children. She lives alone in her own house, occupying two rooms with brick walls and a dirt floor. Her house is located in the Palomar neighborhood in the City of La Paz. 

Valentina dedicates herself full-time to her agricultural activities, as this is the only source of income she has with which she can cover her living expenses. Neither of her children support her financially, even though she could use the help. 

The loan that she is asking for will be invested in purchasing modified seeds, which do not require as much water and require shorter growing time. With these seeds she will be able to grow her products more efficiently while also protecting the environment. 

Valentina's dream is to one day also raise livestock, so that she can improve her income and her quality of life. 

This is the first loan that she is asking for from IMPRO, and also her first time working with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy modified seeds to improve the quality of her harvest

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
This is Brenda. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy vegetables. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to purchase more vegetables needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Brenda dreams to expand her business and hopes to give her children a good life.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables needed for her business

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala, tiene su pareja pero no esta casada, tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en casa de sus familiares ocupando cuatro habitaciones con pisos de tierra, la casa se encuentra en la población de Palomar en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente ella junto a su pareja se dedican a la agricultura y engorde de ganado por mas de ocho horas al día soportando los cambios climáticos del tiempo ya que deben cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo necesita para la compra de semilla mejorada ya que les ayudara en su producción por que es en menos tiempo y no requiere de mucho riego, ahorrando agua que es muy importante para el medio ambiente de la región. Además, el producto es de mejor calidad.
El sueño de Pascuala, es aumentar su producción y su ganado para poder ahorrar o seguir invirtiendo para el futuro de sus hijos de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y también la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Pascuala is in a relationship but is not married. She has two school-aged children, and lives in a house with other family members that has four rooms with dirt floors. Their house is located in the Palomar neighborhood in the city of La Paz. 

Currently, Pascuala and her partner work in agriculture, planting crops and raising livestock for more than 8 hours every day. They must face the climate change which has affected their crops, and with their earnings must cover their food, education, and other basic expenses. 

The loan that Pascuala is asking for is for the purchase of genetically modified seeds, which will help her to increase her production in less time and will allow her to use less water - saving a very valuable local resource. Additionally, the seeds will produce a higher quality crop. 

Pascuala's dream is to increase her crop and livestock production to be able to earn enough money to save. She wants to continue to invest in her children's future, improving their quality of life. 

This is the first loan that she is asking for from IMPRO, and the first time she has worked with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy modified seeds to improve the quality and efficiency of her harvest

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is 41, and the mother of four children.  Her husband owns an electrical shop in which he sells electrical products, and also provides services for repairing electric water motors and pumps.  He binds the motors of washing machines, water pumps, and ceiling fans.  For this purpose he needs a lot of copper cable coils which are very expensive and out of his purchasing power.  Therefore, Nazia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, to empower her husband to buy copper coils to carry on his services. In addition he wants to buy some extra electrical switches, bulbs, bulb holders, sockets etc.

This is first loan of Nazia.

loans.use: to buy copper wire coils, switches, sockets, etc., for her husband's business

loans.name: Africana

texts.en:
Africana is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She is a married woman, 45, with two children, one of whom is still in school.

Africana has a direct selling personal collection products business in the Philippines. 

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more products of personal collection to sell.

Africana has been in this business for seven years, and she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products of personal collections to sell

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald dreams of becoming a chef, but without a degree, knows it may never be possible. To achieve his goal, Ronald has enrolled in INFOCAL. He expects to graduate in December 2013, but without a loan, is unsure how he will be able to continue to afford his education. He shares that his alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until he could return. Ronald shares that it is important to him to graduate on time so he can earn a higher wage as soon as possible. 

Ronald plans on using the loan to cover the cost of his graduation fees. Often, there are fees for earning your title in the culinary arts before graduating. In addition to his responsibilities at school, Ronald currently works 30 hours a week and earns $6 a day as a kitchen assistant. With a career as a chef, he expects to earn $20 a day, a substantial increase from before. 

Ronald's parents were never able to complete their primary education. For his family, finances have always been tight. With three other siblings, Ronald is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana loan. Ronald's father's salary from his job as a merchant is the family's primary source of income. Ronald hopes to be able to contribute towards his family's income in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.en:
Carlos's dream is to work in industrial food engineering. To achieve his goal, Carlos has enrolled in the Universidad Indigena Boliviano Aynara Tupak Katari. He plans on graduating in December 2015, but without a loan from Vittana, he thinks that he may need to take time off to work and save until he can return to school. 

With this loan, Carlos plans on purchasing his much-needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Carlos feels he will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. 

Carlos currently works 30 hours a week. With a career in food science, he expects to earn $39 a day, a substantial increase from before. With two older siblings attending college already, Carlos is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for books and school supplies.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.ru:
Родной город Осанны Сухуми(Грузия). В 1989 г. ей вместе с семьей пришлось покинуть этот город и переехать на Украину в г.Каменка-Днепровская. В Сухуми  началась война и поэтому Осанне пришлось оставить свой дом и родные места, чтобы сохранить своих детей и забыть ужасы войны. 

В Украине, в Каменке уже поселились несколько ее родственников и поэтому было не так страшно. Первые года приходилось трудно, так как нужно было начинать все с нуля. Занялись сельским хозяйством и жизнь стала налаживаться. Семья трудилась , строили теплицы, появились новые друзья. Очень помогали родственники. В этом вопросе они очень дружные, если случается беда, считают своим долгом явиться на помощь. 

Сейчас у Осанны отличное большое хозяйство, несколько теплиц. Однако клиентка не останавливается на достигнутом, продолжает улучшать и расширять бизнес и в этом году проводит отопление в теплицы. Большую помощь в развитии бизнеса оказывают ей кредиты "Надежды Украины". В этот раз Оксана купит отопительный котел и шланги за 40 тыс. грн., что поможет ей получить дополнительную прибыль и в следующем годурасширить свой бизнес еще - построить  большие теплицы.
texts.en:
Oksana had to leave her hometown of Sukhumi (Georgia). In 1989, together with her family they had to leave this city and move to Ukraine in the Kamenka, Dneiper region. In Sukhumi a war had begun and because of this Oksana had to leave her home and homeland to save her children and forget the horrors of war. 

Some relatives had already settled in Kamenka, Ukraine and because of this it was not so difficult. 

The first year was hard because they started with nothing. They started in agriculture and their life began to adjust. The family worked, built a greenhouse, and made new friends. Their relatives helped greatly. In this regard they are very friendly. If something bad happens, they consider it their duty to come to the rescue. 

Now Oksana has a great big farm, and a few greenhouses. However, this client does not stop there, she continues to improve and expand the business, and this year she will put heating in the greenhouses. A great deal of the help in business development loans came from "Hope Ukraine." This time Oksana is buying a boiler and pipes for 40 thousand Hryvnia, to help her become more profitable in the next year and expand her business - building a large greenhouse.

loans.use: to purchase heaters and install heating systems in green houses.

loans.name: Heum

texts.en: Bakan is a big district located in Pursat province. The most popular career is farming. One local farmer, Heum, owns and manages around two hectares of farmland for rice cultivation, from which she is able to generate a regular profit of KHR 30,000 per day to cover her daily household expenses. Furthermore, she still supports two school-age children who are living under her control. Currently, Heum would like to have a loan from HKL in the sum of KHR 1,000,000 to build a toilet to improve the sanitation of her family, as she doesn't have a safe toilet to use. Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL and Kiva with a special interest rate, she is encouraged to focus on healthy living conditions, safeguarding the health of her family and protecting the environment.

loans.use: to build a toilet to improve the sanitation of her family.

loans.name: Chiep

texts.en:
Chiep, 50 years old, is a local farmer who has been living in Pursat province. She is married with seven children: one married and five single. Chiep is in the business of cultivating rice and has the support of her husband and children. From her hardships, she is able to make a suitable income of KHR 30,000 per day, which goes towards meals, commodities costs, and school allowances for her children. 

Currently, Chiep would like to borrow a loan from HKL in the sum of KHR 4,000,000 to build a toilet to improve the sanitation of her family, as she doesn't had a safe toilet to use in her household. Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL and Kiva with a special interest rate, she is encouraged to focus on healthy living conditions, safeguarding the health of her family and protecting the environment.

loans.use: to build a toilet to improve the sanitation of her family.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
This is Remedios, 53, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Mario and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Remedios operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. She also has a food stall for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php800 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php8,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Remedios hopes that her business will be successful and dreams that her family will be happy and content.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria Ana

texts.en:
Maria Ana works hard to support her family. Maria Ana is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Maria Ana requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Maria Ana has been in this business for 7 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her fish vending business.

In the future, Maria Ana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 49 years old, married, and has three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Helen has a food vending business in the Philippines. Helen requested a 29,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like frozen foods, juice, etc., for her food vending business.

Helen has been in this business for 6 years. Helen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like frozen foods, juice, etc., for her food vending business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 38 years old, married, and has four children. With two children currently in school, Helen works very hard to provide for them.

Helen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Helen has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sanitary napkins, snack foods, noodles, soy sauce, vinegar, etc. 

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to further their education.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Agusta

texts.en:
Agusta is 49 years old and married with six children. With four children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Agusta runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like eggs, noodles, candies, vinegar, shampoo, etc. to sell in her general store.

Agusta has been in this business for 30 years, and sells a variety of items such as eggs, noodles, candies, vinegar, shampoo, etc. 

In the future, Agusta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like eggs, noodles, candies, vinegar, shampoo, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Caryn Joy

texts.en:
Caryn Joy is a 32-year-old married woman with one child who is in school. Caryn Joy has a direct selling personal collection products business in the Philippines;she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Caryn Joy requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like lotion, body spray, bath soap, toothpaste, etc. to sell.

Caryn Joy has been in this business for three years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like lotion, body spray, bath soap, toothpaste, etc. to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vehicle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her vehicle for her vehicle transport business.

Emma has been in this business for 15 years. Emma earns additional income from running a general store.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her vehicle

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 41 years old, married, and has three children. With two children still in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional products like milk, fabric softeners, shampoo, coffee, sugar, canned goods, etc., to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as milk, shampoo, coffee, sugar, canned goods, fabric softener, etc. 

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional products like milk, fabric softener, shampoo, coffee, sugar, canned goods, etc., to sell

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria works hard to support her family. Gregoria is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Gregoria requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

Gregoria has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Gregoria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy additional products for her variety store. Her loan also helped in the education of her children. Her income from her business assisted in their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ana dreams that her business will get bigger and hopes to have a happy family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Elba

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of two children, Elba works hard to support her family. She has a videoke machine rental business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. 

Elba is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her business.

Elba has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Melogina

texts.en:
Melogina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Melogina is 53 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Melogina has a vulcanizing shop business in the Philippines. Melogina requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials and tools for her business.

Melogina has been in this business for four years. In the future, Melogina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and tools for her business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is Rebecca. She previously accessed an 17,000 PHP loan which she used for the repair and maintenance of her room for rent.  Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. She also sells rice for additional income. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for the repair and maintenance of her room for rent. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rebecca hopes that her business will be more successful and dreams that her family will grow in their relationship with God. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her room for rent.

loans.name: Deande

texts.en: Deande is running a general store as an aid to her husband's income from farming. She has been doing this for six years and she was able to provide their daily living. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods for sale. She wants to expand her business using the generated revenue and hopes to sustain it, as this is their other source of income aside from the farm. In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Sandro Nixon

texts.es:
Sandro de 35 años,  estudio hasta 8°  grado, esta acompañado; su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, sus dos hijos viven con él,  uno estudia y le ayuda en sus tiempos libres a trabajar.


Él trabaja la agricultura, estructuras metálicas y pintura, se transporta a los lugares de trabajo en una motocicleta,  su hijo le ayuda a realizar los trabajos.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar material , para realizar un trabajo de hacer unas puertas de hierro, el cual necesita comprar materiales, electrodos, hierro, lamina, pintura etc., con la inversión espera aumentara sus ganancias. 

Su deseo es que sus hijos aprendan un oficio,  con el cual puedan valerse en un futuro, ya que muchas veces no hay los recursos económicos para que puedan estudiar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Sandro is 35 years old and has an 8th grade education.  He is married and his wife takes care of the household. His two children live with him.  One is a student and helps Sandro with his work in his free time. Sandro works in agriculture, metalworking and painting, and he rides a motorcycle to the places where he works.

The loan he is requesting is to buy materials for making iron gates.  He needs to buy electrodes, iron, metal sheets, paint, etc. With this investment he hopes to increase his earnings.  His wish is for his children to learn a trade to use in the future because often times there are no financial resources to enable them to study at the university.

loans.use: to buy materials such as electrodes, iron, metal sheets, paint, etc. for his work making iron gates.

loans.name: Seun

texts.en:
Seun is a farmer and a grocery seller from the Baray district, Kompong Thom province. She is 51 years old, and married with four children. She is a hardworking and honest woman with her daily farming chores and selling activities. 

Through her hardships, she is able to make a normal income of KHR 20,000 per day. Aside from her income, the family relies on the other source of income from her husband, who is in the business of fishing and collecting palm juice to sell.

In order to help Seun improve her family-owned businesses, she has applied for a loan in the amount of KHR 1,000,000, which will be used to buy bamboo ladders for climbing the palm tree. 

In her future plans, Seun wishes to diversity her existing businesses to improve her family and support her children until they graduate.

loans.use: to buy bamboo ladders for climbing the palm tree.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en: Elmer is married, has three children, and manages a food-vending business selling assorted snacks at a school. Aside from this, he has a part-time service that provides motor transportation in his community. He borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy raw ingredients. He plans to improve his business by building his own shelter where he could sell more snacks in the community. In the future, Elmer wants to improve the general living situation of his family.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for his food-vending business.

location.town: Gulayon, Dipolog  City, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel works hard to support her family. Maribel is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Maribel requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like eggs, rice, vegetables, seasonings, etc. for her food production business.

Maribel has been in this business for 15 years now.

Maribel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like eggs, rice, vegetables, seasonings, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 25 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Huaraz, en el distrito de Carhuaz con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Luis no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Luis trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, el trabaja todo los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Luis se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad y variedad de frutas de temporada, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser un gran comerciante.
texts.en:
Luis is 25 years old, single, and lives in the city of Huarez in the district of Carhuaz. He lives with his parents and his brothers here. He is hard working, enthusiastic, and puts all his efforts into improving his life. Unfortunately, because of a lack of financial resources and because he needed to work, Luis was not able to go to university to study for a degree. 
On his own initiative, Luis started a small business selling fruits and vegetables. He works every day for around 10 hours and he thinks that everything is going well for him because of his dedication and hard work. 
Luis find himself very thankful for the lenders ar Kiva, because it is thanks to their help that he will be able to purchase a larger quantity and variety of in-season fruits, and he will be able to continue working and trying to achieve his greatest dream of being a successful businessman.

loans.use: purchase fruit.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo  de 31 años, es un joven muy trabajador.  Presta sus servicios en la policía nacional civil, desde hace 10 años. Wilfredo vive con su esposa, su mamá y su hermana. 
Actualmente, todos aportan algo de ingresos para la familia, ya que la mamá vende guineos maduros desde hace 5 años en el mercado de la ciudad y su esposa es promotora de salud. 
El préstamo que está solicitando, es para construir un muro de contención, abajo de su casa suya, ya que está muy peligroso para ellos.  Además, el espacio del patio es muy pequeño y con la construcción del muro, tendrá más espacio donde puedan jugar los niños.
Wilfredo quiere en un futuro, ampliar más la vivienda ya que con la construcción del muro tendrá más espacio para construirle más a la casa.
texts.en: Wilfredo is a 31 year old hardworking young man. He has served in the national civilian police for over 10 years. Wilfredo lives with his wife, his mother and his sister. Currently, all of them contribute some earnings to the family. His mother has sold ripe bananas in the city market for over 5 years and his wife is a public health worker. The loan he is seeking is for the construction of a retaining wall below his house because it is currently very dangerous for all of them. Moreover, the patio space is very small and with the construction of the wall they will have more space for their children to play in. Wilfredo desires to expand his house in the future. Once he has build the retaining wall he will have more space to expand the house.

loans.use: to build a retaining wall below his house because it is currently very dangerous for him and his family.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa Maria 48 años de edad madre soltera  con tres hijos todos trabajan, originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona donde predomina el comercio, turismo, es propietaria de un salón de belleza, ubicado en uno de los mercados del municipio, donde tiene mayor demanda de sus clientes, los cuales ha medida que pasa el tiempo su clientela ha incrementado por el buen servicio que ella ofrece a todos sus clientes fijos y eventuales, ofrece servicios de planchado, alisado, maquillajes, peinados para toda ocasión, tintes, mechas, tratamientos entre otros mas, al igual que lo realiza de forma domiciliar en su local, inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano cerrando algo tarde ella ama su su profesión lo que le ha ayudado a darse a conocer entre los clientes, uno de sus sueños es poder algún día tener su propio salón sin tener que estar alquilando. el objetivo de este crédito es para cambiar algunos activos fijos de sus salón y comprar productos de bellezas así les brindara un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Rosa Maria esta muy agradecida con los inversionistas kivas por la ayuda que ellos les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos para así tener un trabajo digno.
texts.en: Rosa Maria is 48 years old, a single mother, and all three of her children work. She is from the municipality of Chinandega located in the west of the country. In this area of the country, business and tourism predominate. Rosa Maria is the owner of a beauty salon, located in one of the city markets, where there is a greater demand for her services. She has estimated that over time her clientele has grown because of the good service that she gives to both her regulars and her drop ins. She offers services like straightening, softening, make-overs, up-dos for all occasions, color, highlights and other treatments. She starts her day early in the morning and closes a little late. She loves her profession, one that has helped her to get to know her clients and one of her dreams is to one day have her own salon without needing to pay rent. The goal of this loan is to change some of the permanent installations in her salon and to purchase more beauty products so she can offer a better service to her customers. Rosa Maria is very thankful for the lenders at Kiva because their help gives people with limited resources the opportunity to have a chance at dignified work.

loans.use: purchase beauty products and fixed assets for her salon.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan. She previously accessed an 40,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Susan dreams for a new place for her business and hopes to have a long and happy life.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marilyn works hard to support her family.

She sells directly to customers with her personal collection products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a manicure/pedicure service. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional products to sell to her customers in her personal collection products business.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 53-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a chain maker; he makes iron chains of different lengths and sells it to the hardware shops. He makes the iron chains by his hands in his workshop. The chain is made on a hearth by hammering cut lengths of red-hot wrought iron rod into oval links, one link passing through the next to form a cable. He solders each joint to give it strength.

Nowadays his gas cylinder for soldering has been finished, and his soldering rods as well. He has spend all his savings upon necessities; this is the reason he is not in a condition to buy a new gas cylinder and soldering rods. 

Therefore, Shehnaz requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy a new gas cylinder and soldering rods for making chains. 

She is the mother of seven children and it is very difficult to feed all of them daily. Her dreams are to provide all the necessities to each of her children. Shehnaz is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan for this honorable favor.

loans.use: to purchase a gas cylinder and soldering rods for her husband's job making iron chains.

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en: Arnel is a single entrepreneur who runs a general store to make a living. He has been doing this business for two years in order to support his parents and family. He borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase more grocery goods for sale. He plans to expand his business in order to gain more revenue. In the future, Arnel wants to improve the general living situation of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods for sale.

loans.name: Marize

texts.en:
Marize works hard to support her family. Marize is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years now.

Marize requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

In the future, Marize would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza hace 35 años tiene un restaurante, donde vende comidas corrientes y a la carta, además de bollos de mazorca, un amasijo de maíz envuelto y cocido al cual le agrega queso. Su negocio lo recibió de su madre cuando le dijo que lo atendiera para descansar un poco y desde esa época no se detiene.  El restaurante se encuentra ubicado e su propio domicilio y vende de contado y a crédito durante todos los días, desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde  en su propia vecindad. Sus compras las realiza de contado y en depósitos mayoristas  del municipio de Puerto Colombia, ubicado a orillas del Mar Caribe.  Sus metas mas adelante consisten en independizar el negocio de la vivienda y en remodelar su casa para tener un poco de mayor sosiego familiar y sentirse mucho más confortable. En la actualidad Maritza tienen un contrato de suministro de almuerzos, que le generará nuevas ganancias y una nueva clientela, pero su capacidad de compra es inferior a su requerimiento, por esta razón está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará víveres para dar respuesta a su nuevos compradores fijos. Con esta inversión aumentarían sus ventas y sus utilidades, para hacer de su credikiva la mejor inversión.
texts.en:
Maritza has had a restaurant for 35 years, where she sells both comida corriente [a daily set menu] and a la carte. She also sells bollos de mazorca, which are rolls of corn dough that are wrapped in husks, steamed and served with shredded cheese. Maritza received the restaurant from her mother, who asked her to look after it while she took some time off. Since that time, Maritza has not stopped.  

Maritza’s restaurant is located in her own home, and it is open every day from six in the morning until three in the afternoon. She makes her sales in cash and on credit, and she buys what she needs in cash at wholesale warehouses in the municipality of Puerto Colombia, which is on the edge of the Caribbean Sea.

Maritza’s goal for the future is to separate the restaurant from her home and remodel her house to make it more relaxing and comfortable for her family.

Maritza currently has a contract to provide lunches, which has improved her income and brought her new customers. She says that she is applying for a Kiva loan because her ability to purchase supplies is less than what she needs. Maritza will use this loan to buy supplies in larger quantities so that she can meet the increased demand of her new customers. She says that she will make the most of her Kiva loan to increase her sales and her profit.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her restaurant in larger quantities.

loans.name: Asel

texts.en:
Asel is a first-year student of the American University of Central Asia, department of European Studies. Here is her story:
“There are lots of universities in Kyrgyzstan. In my opinion AUCA is the best university in our country. It was founded in 1992 and since that time it has produced many talented and successful students. I am very much interested in this university because of the elective educational system. I believe that it is very important that you can choose the subjects which you need in your future profession and life. The second reason is that AUCA stands against corruption. AUCA values your diligence, desire to study and acquire knowledge; thereby this university provides professionals and experts that our country really needs. AUCA gives its students lots of opportunities. There are many different clubs, conferences, and events that help students to broaden their mind, to become more independent and help to build their personalities. Furthermore, AUCA has international cooperation with other colleges and universities, for example with Bard College, which means that AUCA can provide the possibility to earn a Masters Degree abroad. One of the opportunities that AUCA gives to its students is financial aid, which is very helpful. I would like to apply for a Kiva loan so that I could cover my tuition fees.”

loans.use: to pay for higher education.

loans.name: Volodya

texts.ru:
Володе  и его семье пришлось не легко, после того как они покинули родину – Грузию. Вот  уже 16 лет как они живут на Украине. У Володи очень добрая жена-помощница и пятеро детей.  

Володе приходилось много трудиться, чтобы прокормить семью и накопить деньги на  хороший дом, ведь он глава семьи. Со временем купили дом и это было очень радостным событием. К дому шла земля, где Володя теперь мог  выращивать овощи самостоятельно. Первое время садили помидоры без пленки, но это не приносило большого дохода. Поэтому начали строить большие, капитальные, арочные теплицы. В них  удобно трудиться, да и урожай значительно увеличился. 

Теперь пришло время подумать об отоплении и поэтому он взял кредит на покупку котла и всех комплектующих к нему в «Надежде Украины». Володя уже несколько раз брал кредиты на развитие своего бизнеса  иочень благодарен за оказываемую помощь.
texts.en: Volodya and his family had a difficult time after leaving their homeland, the Republic of Georgia. It has already been 16 years since they came to Ukraine. Volodya has a wonderful partner in his wife, and they have five children. Volodya worked very hard to feed his family and save money for a good house, since he is after all, the head of the family. It took a while for them to be able to buy a house, and it was a joyful occasion. With the house came land, where Volodya now grows vegetables independently. First he planted tomatoes uncovered, but it didn't bring much profit. He then began to build large, permanent, arched greenhouses. The greenhouses are comfortable to work in, and harvest has significantly increased. Now it is time to think about heating, so Volodya is requesting a loan from Hope Ukraine to buy a complete boiler. Volodya has received loans several time for development of his business, and he is very grateful for the assistance given.

loans.use: to purchase and install a greenhouse heating system

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 33 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Aileen works very hard to provide for them.

Aileen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items like eggs, shampoo, hair conditioner, vinegar, and cooking oil to sell.

Aileen has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, shampoo, hair conditioner, vinegar, cooking oil, etc. 

In the future, Aileen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like eggs, shampoo, hair conditioner, vinegar, and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Mary Claire

texts.en:
Mary Claire is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a purified drinking water business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional containers of purified drinking water to sell in her business.

Mary Claire has been in this business for 3 years. She earns more income from the general store.

Mary Claire has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay coffee pickers, to buy fertilizer, and to clear his land

loans.name: Naipah

texts.en:
Naipah is 27 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Naipah has a dry goods business in the Philippines. Naipah requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more blouses, pants, bags, slippers etc. to sell.

Naipah has been in this business for 12 years. Naipah would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more blouses, pants, bags, slippers etc. to sell

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 42 years old and a married woman. She has four children, three of them in school. She is a responsible mother.  Two of her children are young and fully dependent upon them as parents. Her two other children go to school and it is very difficult for her to provide them with higher education. Shazia wants to generate some savings so that she can provide higher education to her children, but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income. 

Her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw for many years and he is earning enough for their expenses. He has to maintain the auto rickshaw but he does not have a sufficient amount of money to fix the problem. Therefore, Shazia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband will be able to repair the auto rickshaw. 

Shazia hopes that she will be able to create enough savings while their young children grow, and that she will be successful in providing higher education to her children.

loans.use: and her husband fix the problem with the Auto Rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his house

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is married with three children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family. She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for 4 years.  She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity.

Annet has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shilling from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She works from home seven days a week and sells to all categories of people, both retail and wholesale. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. 

Annet is aspiring to sell wholesale only and also to build her own house. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Seferina

texts.es: Doña Seferina agradece a los inversionistas en KIVA y a la cooperativa COMIXMUL por haber apoyado su necesidad con un financiamiento el cual fue destinado para la compra de insumos agrícolas los cuales ayudaron a la asistencia de sus cultivos de hortalizas comprando 5 QQ de abono, 3 QQ de urea, 5 kilos de mancoseth y 1 litro de Fulnecs con lo que pudo asistir sus cultivos de papa logrando obtener una excelente cosecha de 50 QQ de papa las que pudo vender a muy buen precio gracias a la excelente temporada con la cual pudo cancelar su compromiso y poder acercarse nuevamente a las instalaciones de la cooperativa para solicitar un segundo financiamiento. Con este nuevo financiamiento ella quiere terminar de preparar la tierra que tiene sin cultivar y poder sembrar semilla de papa certificada ya que de esta manera ella podrá cultivar una mayor cantidad y obtener mayores entradas de efectivo para seguir fortaleciendo sus cultivos y el patrimonio para su familia.
texts.en: Seferina is thankful to the Kiva investors and to the COMIXMUL cooperative for their support of her needs with a loan that is for the purpose of purchasing agricultural supplies which help support her vegetable crops. With this loan she is buying 5 Kg. of fertilizer, 3 Kg. of urea, 5 kilos of Mancoseth and 1 liter of Fulnecs with which she can support her potato crops with the goal of obtaining an excellent harvest of 50 Kg. of potatoes. She can sell the potatoes for a very good price during an excellent season and with her earnings she can cancel her debt and approach the co-op buildings anew to seek a second loan. With this loan she wants to complete the preparation of her soil that is currently cropless and to be able to plant certified potato seeds. This way she will be able to grow a bigger quantity and obtain a better start in the future to continue strengthening her crops and the heritage of her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to prepare the soil to cultivate new potato seeds.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel runs a general store in the community of Gulayon in Zamboanga del Norte. She has been doing this for five years, and she was able to provide for the needs of her children. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to to purchase additional grocery goods for sale. She is hopeful to see her two children successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods for sale.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a 35-year-old hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer who mainly rears cattle, but also earns a salary as a coordinator hired by local government to offer agricultural advisory services to other farmers. 

A good father that he is, he desires to educate his children to attain degrees as minimum qualification, and set up sustainable income generating activities. Prolonged drought and high cost of operation hinder his business profits, while his desire is to own a big and productive dairy farm. Philip intends to use the loan to buy three cows for rearing.

loans.use: to buy three cows for rearing.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa works hard to support her family. Narcisa is married and has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines.

Narcisa requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables and spices to sell.

Narcisa has been in this business for 20 years now.

Narcisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and spices to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 41 years old and married with five children.

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Teresita has borrowed and paid back 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years, and earns additional income from handicraft. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Teresita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene is a married woman, she has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her business.
 
With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase 8 sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 8 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is a widowed woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Amparo is 63 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Amparo has a rug making business in the Philippines. Amparo requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials, such as fabric, thread, etc. for her business.

Amparo has been in this business for 6 years. Amparo would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials, such as fabric, thread, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to remodel a room.

loans.name: Elestina

texts.en:
Elestina is a hardworking woman who strives to improve her family's living standards. A previous loan helped her buy clothes for resale, which gave her profit and lifted the living standards of her family. 

Now again she comes to you, requesting another loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy two bales of clothes to sell. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy two bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school, and one is still young. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables, such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio de 53 años, estudio hasta cuarto grado, por la situación económica que pasaba su familia no logro seguir estudiando.  Él es casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su hogar, actualmente en su vivienda viven sus 5 hijos que se encuentran estudiando y que en los momentos libres le ayudan en los trabajos agrícolas y que son las únicas personas que dependen de él.  


Julio,  se dedica a la agricultura en la siembra de granos básicos (maíz, frijol), desde que estaba pequeño sus padres le inculcaron a aprender este trabajo, como era la única alternativa de trabajo y de ingresos en aquellos tiempos, por eso se dedicaba a la agricultura. Aparte de dedicarse a la agricultura, también se dedica a la ganadería en la compra y venta de  ganado que es otra actividad que le genera ingresos económicos para su familia.  Para llegar a su lujar de trabajo tiene que caminar 30 minutos a pie, que también recibe el apoyo de sus hijos y esposa para realizar los trabajos agrícolas.

   El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar insumos agrícolas y para la recolección de granos básicos (maíz, frijol). El préstamo le ayudara, a recolectar los frutos más adecuadamente y eficientemente en el tiempo específico, sin mayores complicaciones de perdida.

Julio, desea para el futuro tener una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia, y obtener  mayor  producción de granos básicos y vivir cómodamente en un lugar digno para que sus hijos y que sigan estudiando para que en el futuro sean  personas profesionales y logren terminar sus estudios y sacar  una carrera universitaria, todo esto lo lograra con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación con su  esposo y mucho trabajo.
texts.en:
Julio, 53, studied through the fourth grade.  He wasn't able to keep on studying because of his family's financial situation.  He's married and his wife spends her time taking care of the home.  Currently his five dependent children live in his house.  They're students who they help him with the farming chores in their free time.

Julio makes a living in agriculture growing basic grains (corn and beans).  His parents taught him to do this job from a young age.  He earned a living in agriculture because it was his only alternative for work and income at that time.  In addition to farming, he also generates an income for his family in ranching, buying and selling cattle.  Julio has to walk for 30 minutes to get to where he works.  He also has the help of his children and his wife with the farming labor.

The loan Julio's requesting is to buy agricultural inputs and to harvest the corn and beans.  The loan will help him harvest the crops better and more efficiently in a timely fashion and without any complications or loss.

Julio wants to have a better quality of life for himself and his family in the future.  He also wants to grow more basic grains and live comfortably in a decent place.  This way his children will continue studying so in the future they can be professionals and finish their studies and go to college.  He will achieve all this with a lot of effort and dedication with his wife and a lot of work.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and to harvest corn and beans

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: La señora Antonia trabajo de muy joven en el comercio tanto en la localidad de Santa Cruz como en el trópico de Cochabamba, lamentablemente por problemas de entendimiento con su pareja esta separada, actualmente tiene un dependiente su hija menor que esta estudiando en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, para poder ayudar a su hija  con  los  estudios la señora Antonia trabaja con el comercio de refrigerios ofreciendo este servicio en su casa y también vendiendo de ambulante en la calle, en los últimos años a tenido algunos inconvenientes por su salud que no le a permitido tener capital para mejorar sus servicios, por esta razón solicita un crédito para la compra de  una heladera que le permita mejorar  los  servicios de refrigerios y la venta de jugos  tropicales, de esta forma seguirá colaborando con los estudios de  su  hija que aun le falta culminar el ultimo año.
texts.en: Since she was very young, Antonia has had businesses both in Santa Cruz and in the tropics of Cochabamba.  Unfortunately she and her husband are separated due to irreconcilable differences.  She has one dependent, her youngest daughter who is studying in the city of Santa Cruz. In order to help her daughter with her education, Antonia has a small business selling snacks.  She sells snacks from her home and in the streets. In the last few years she has had some setbacks due to her health and has not had the capital to improve her services.  She is therefore requesting a loan to purchase a refrigerator.  This will allow her to improve her business selling snacks and tropical drinks.  In this way she will continue supporting her daughter's education, as her daughter still has one year left.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Khoren

texts.ru:
18 лет назад из Грузии  в Украину приехал молодой человек. Через некоторое время здесь он встретил прекрасную женщину, женился , купил дом и стал заниматься сельским хозяйством. С каждым годом он стараться сделать свой бизнес прибыльнее для этого прилагал все усилия. В начале садили овощи без пленки, потом построили маленькие теплички, потом еще раз их переделывали и вот сейчас у них уже стоят арочные большие теплицы. Чтобы их построить Хорену очень помогли кредиты предоставленные «Надеждой Украины».

У Хорена есть отличные помощники, жена и четверо детей. В этом году выдали замуж одну из дочерей и поэтому Хорен хотел как можно больше вложить труда, чтобы помочь молодым в начале совместной жизни. Он установил в своих теплицах отопление, однако его постигла неудача. Он приобрел некачественные, токсичные шланги и из-за этого погибла рассада. Пришлось выкинуть шланги, продать котел и покупать рассаду. Но Хорен не отчаялся и опять обратился за помощью в «Надежду Украины», теперь на полученные средства он сможет приобрести новый котел и шланги. Он очень надеется, что в этот раз у него будет хороший урожай и дополнительная прибыль, с которой он сможет помогать своим детям.
texts.en:
Eighteen years ago a young man arrived in Ukraine from the Republic of Georgia. As time passed, he met a wonderful woman, married, bought a house and began to farm. He has applied all his strength to trying to make his business more profitable each year. At first he grew vegetables unprotected outside, then built small greenhouses, and they redid them again so that he now has large hoop greenhouses. The organization Hope Ukraine helped Khoren greatly in building the greenhouses. 

Khoren has fantastic helpers: his wife and four children. This year one of his daughters was married, so Khoren wanted to put as much extra work in as he could in order to help the young couple start their life together. He started heating the greenhouses, but it didn't go well. He got low quality, toxicant tubing, which caused his seedlings to die. Still, Khoren did not give up, and is again asking Hope Ukraine for help, so that he can buy a new boiler and  tubing. He very much hopes that this time he will have a good harvest and earn extra income which he can use to help his children.

loans.use: to purchase a quality greenhouse heating system

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella is running her general store in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years as an aid to her husband's income from employment. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to buy grocery goods to sell. While her children has their own families, Estrella never ceases her support if they needed it. She wants to improve the general living of the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for sale.

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy is 39 years old and married with five children.

Analy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items, such as canned goods, diapers, biscuits, snack foods, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

Analy has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years, and earns additional income from selling purified drinking water.

Analy aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional items, such as canned goods, diapers, biscuits, snack foods, soft-drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cheryl is 36 years old and has four children who are in school.

Cheryl has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more ingredients, such as meat, rice, vegetables, spices, etc. for her business.

Cheryl has been in this business for 16 years. Cheryl would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients, such as meat, rice, vegetables, spices, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius used his previous loan to buy general merchandise to sell. He is a 27-year-old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is a retail shop. He also sews clothes to boost his income. He faces hardships of limited capital, but he has a vision of buying land to venture into farming. Julius is requesting a loan to buy soap, sugar, and sewing materials for his businesses.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar and sewing materials for his businesses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: A loan $1500 helps M. Rafi to buy a buffalo to get more milk.

loans.name: Ararat

texts.ru:
Осенью Арарату предложили приобрести хороший большой участок земли под строительство теплиц. Этот участок Арарат приметил уже давно и очень обрадовался, что теперь он продается. Однако нужно было отдать крупную сумму денег, которой у Арарата не было. Арарат в очередной раз обратился за помощью, чтобы взять кредит 40 тыс. грн и приобрести дополнительный участок.
