"Спасибо за вашу помощь, самостоятельно я бы не справился и участок купили бы другие люди». У Арарата есть планы на будущее - он хочет построить на новом участке две теплицы, поэтому надеется на дальнейшее сотрудничество с КИВОЙ.
texts.en: In the fall Ararat proposed buying a good sized piece of land to build greenhouses on. Ararat had noticed the plot a while back, and was very happy to see it offered for sale. However, he didn't have the large sum of money needed for payment. Ararat has again asked for help in order to get a loan for 40,000 hryvnia to buy the additional land. He says thank you for the help, since he would not have been able to pay otherwise and others would have bought the land. Ararat has plans for the future - he wants to build greenhouses on the new land, so he hopes to continue working with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase land for building green houses

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es una persona muy trabajadora, vive en el departamento de Cochabamba en la casa de sus padres, es madre soltera. Dedica todo su tiempo al cuidado de su familia y del ganado que tiene para la producción de leche cruda de buena calidad. 
Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para dar alimento a las vacas lecheras, luego prepara a sus niños para que vayan a la escuela de su localidad. Después de ordeñar a las vacas entrega la leche al módulo de su zona. Es sus tiempos libres busca otros trabajos como lavar ropa para para percibir mayores ingresos lo cual es muy sacrificado. 
Cristina solicita un crédito para  comprar una vaca lechar adicional para incrementar la producción de leche cruda, mejorando sus ingresos y su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Cristina is a hard working woman. She lives in the county of Cochabamba in the home of her parents. She is a single mother. She dedicates all of her time to caring for her family and for the cattle that she has that produce high quality raw milk. Every day she gets up very early to feed the milk cows. Later she prepares her children for their departure for the local school. After milking the cows she deposits the milk in her neighborhood storage container. In her free time she seeks out other jobs, like washing clothing, to obtain larger earnings which she sacrifices a lot for. Cristina is seeking a loan to buy a new milk cow to increase her production of raw milk, thereby improving her earnings and her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es: Maria Elizabeth, casada originaria de uno de los municipios del norte del país, zona donde predomina el comercio, ganadería, venta de oro bruto, entre otros mas, María es propietaria de un tramo algo pequeño en uno de los mercados del municipio donde ofrece productos de granos básicos  diarios como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, golosinas y productos de pulperia, ella realiza sus compras a camiones distribuidores a comerciantes de granos básicos que ofrecen a los puestos de mercados sus compras son al contado al igual que sus ventas, se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, con muchos deseos de superación personal, inicia su negocio con sus esfuerzos propios y con ahorros que ella tenia de trabajos anteriores, el objetivo de este crédito es para capital de trabajo en invertir en la compra de productos de consumo del hogar, y así ofrecer una mejor variedad de productos a sus clientes, uno de sus sueños es poder ver su negocio un día grande y prospero bien surtido para que sea productivo y asi obtener mayores utilidades.-
texts.en: Maria Elizabeth is married.  She is originally from one of the municipalities in the north of the country, an area where there are a lot of businesses such as ranching and sale of raw gold, among other things.  Maria owns a small stand in one of the municipal markets where she offers basic products such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, candy and groceries.  She purchases her products from trucks that distribute basic grains and require immediate payment, and she makes cash sales.  She is an entrepreneurial woman, with a great desire to succeed.  She started her business on her own with savings from prior jobs.  The purpose of this loan is to use as working capital to invest in purchasing home products, so she can offer a greater variety to her customers.  One of her dreams is to see her business grow large, prosperous, and well stocked so it can make money and be more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase basic grans like rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, candy, etc.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El señor Mario tiene 37 años de edad, el vive en la comunidad de Chimore, él se encuentra concubinato con la cual tiene tres hijos,  Mario trabaja como Agricultor con la producción de papaya, cítricos y piña en el Sindicato Estaño Palmito. Mario  vivía en otra comunidad  hace como veinte años atrás, sin embargo tuvo que emigrar a la comunidad de Chimore  porque no tuvo ingresos suficientes, ellos se volvieron a levantar y junto a su esposa tomaron un nuevo rumbo en su camino empezaron de cero, ahora él tiene dos lotes agrícolas y un lote urbano en la comunidad donde vive.  El préstamo que solicita Mario es para la construcción de su vivienda y de esa manera podrá dar una mejor calidad de vida y ayudar a su hijos a terminar el colegio. Mario sueña con un futuro mejor para sus hijos ya que el no pudo terminar el colegio ni hacer una carrera, pero él quiere que su hijos si puedan realizar una carrera y poder ayudar a las personas de la zona.
texts.en:
Mario, 37, lives in the community of Chimore.  He lives with his partner, with whom he has three children.  Mario works as a farmer growing papaya, citrus, and pineapple on the Sindicato Estaño Palmito.

Mario used to live in another community 20 years ago, but he had to immigrate to Chimore because he didn't earn enough income.  He and his wife picked up and started off from zero in a new direction.  Now he has two farming plots and an urban plot in the community where he lives.

The loan Mario's requesting is to build his house so he can have a better quality of life and help his children finish school.

Mario dreams of a better future for his children because he wasn't able to finish school or have a career.  He wants his children to be able to have careers and help people in the area.

loans.use: to build his house

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Sopheap is 40 years old and a widowed mother with four dependent children. She tackles her daily cost of living via cassava farming as the main source of income. This business has returned her about 25,000 KHR per day.  

This is not the original loan for Sopheap with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner); it is her fifth loan cycle. The past loans, which she has repaid with success, have enabled her to relieve the financial burden in her household in a timely way, especially in providing sufficient food for her children. 

Now, she has teamed up a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide, and to pay the plowing fee for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a good income so as she can keep her children in school through college.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide, and to pay the plowing fee for her crop

loans.name: Dmitriy

texts.ru:
Дмитрий живет в с.Водяное. У него есть свое тепличное хозяйство -  4 большие теплицы. Он любит свое дело и  с каждым годом  старается улучшить  хозяйство, найти что-то новое, чтобы вырастить хорошую продукцию. Дмитрий хочет чтобы его товар нравился покупателям, поэтому покупает только лучшие сорта помидор и огурцов. 

Дмитрий обратился за кредитом чтобы приобрести мощный котел для отопления. По новой технологии, которую он узнал, нужно закапывать шланги в землю и тогда корни  будут лучше прогреваться, а это значит что растения меньше будут болеть и иметь лучшее качество. Дмитрий  не остановится на достигнутом, будет искать и другие пути к усовершенствованию своего бизнеса, поэтому рассчитывает на помощь в виде кредитов для его бизнеса и в дальнейшем.
texts.en:
Dmitriy lives in the town of Vodyanoye. He has four large greenhouses on his property. He loves his work and with each year tries to improve his business and find new ways to produce an excellent product. Dmitriy wants customers to like his produce, so he buys only the best types of tomatoes and cucumbers. 

Dmitriy is asking for a loan to buy a high-powered heater. He has learned of new techniques involving heating hoses in the ground which warm the plant roots better, and result in better plants with fewer disease issues. Dmitriy never stops striving - he will continue searching for new ways to improve his business, so he is counting on continued assistance by means of loans for his business.

loans.use: to purchase a new heating system for greenhouses

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is a single entrepreneur who runs a general store in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this since she had to stop her studies. 

She joined GDMPC recently so she could gain access to micro-finance services. She has requested a loan to buy additional grocery goods and livestock feed to sell. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods and livestock feed to sell

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Людмила выращивает огурцы  и помидоры на своем участке. Она очень активная и предприимчивая, успевает потрудиться на огороде и еще поторговать рыбой на рынке вместе с мужем. Развивать бизнес им помогает сын, они живут и трудятся все вместе. Недавно Людмила Николаевна увидела, что продается хороший дом с большим участком земли, где есть две больших теплицы.

Она поняла, что его обязательно нужно приобрести, это расширит их бизнес, да и сын сможет жить уже отдельно. Имея опыт кредитования бизнеса от КИВЫ Людмила не раздумывая обратилась за кредитом  в « Надежду Украины». Людмила и ее семья благодарны за возможность расширения бизнеса и жилья благодаря КИВА кредитам и надеются на дальнейшее сотрудничество.
texts.en:
Ludmila grows cucumbers and tomatoes on her property. She is energetic and enterprising. She has been successful working in the garden, and also sells fish at the market with her husband. Their son is also helping develop the business. He lives and works with them. Recently Ludmila noticed that a nice house with a large piece of land with two large greenhouses is up for sale. 

She knows that her son must buy this property so that he can expand their business, and live there separately. Having experience with loans from KIVA, Ludmila did not hesitate to contact Hope Ukraine for a loan. Ludmila and her family are grateful for the ability to expand their business and housing thanks to KIVA loans, and they hope for continued collaboration.

loans.use: to buy a house with large piece of land and two greenhoues

loans.name: Kuok

texts.en: Kuok, originally from Takeo province, is a mother of seven children and is aged 51. She strives to make a living via rice farming. She has had this business for 23 years. Kuok is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking her first loan in order to cover the tuition fees for her son who wants to earn a bachelors degree majoring in Finance and Banking. She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduating.

loans.use: To cover the tuition fees for her son

loans.name: Clemente

texts.en: Clemente, 61 years of age, is married and they are blessed with four children. He has been in the farming business for almost fifty years and earned a net income of 30,000 PHP last harvest season. His profits were spent on his hog raising business, for which he purchased hog feed and hogs to raise for additional income. Due to insufficient funds, Clemente would like to request a loan amounting to 30,000 PHP for his rice farming to purchase fertilizer, insecticide, and seedlings for his farm. He's hoping that his requested loan will be granted so that his business will become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, insecticide, and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Marya

texts.ru:
Мария замужем. У нее есть один ребенок. Мария имеет свое  ателье.

На протяжении девяти лет Мария занимается пошивом, прокатом и продажей детских костюмов. Помещение для бизнеса арендует. Благодаря хорошему вкусу в шитье одежды, Мария имеет много покупателей. Она трудолюбивая и ответственная.

Мария просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 20,000 гривен на закупку ткани для вышивки. Дополнительную прибыль она хочет потратить на ремонт в своем доме.
texts.en:
Marya is married, has a child, and owns a shop.

For nine years, Marya has been sewing, lending, and selling children's clothing. She rents the space for her business. Thanks to her good taste in clothing, Marya has many customers. She is hardworking and responsible. 

Marya is asking for a loan of 20,000 UAH in order to buy fabric for sewing. She plans to use her additional profits for home renovation.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for sewing

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a 30-year-old man, married with one child and living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has a retail shop business that sells phones, radios and stationery. He has been operating this business for four years. He obtains additional income from phone charging, banning music, and a video hall. He started his business to get more income for educating his children, like any parent who likes education, and to provide communication gadgets to the rural people. He is faced with a lack of capital to expand his business to a wholesale business to serve more people in the rural area. Edward is requesting a loan to buy phones and accessories to sell.

loans.use: to buy phones and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en: Aziz is a 28-year-old married man who lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He operates a grocery store. He has three years of experience in this business; therefore, he has a great deal of knowledge about the market and the demands of customers. He is a very successful entrepreneur. He started with a small working capital to open his business. He is the sole source of income for his family. He applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to purchase more grocery products to satisfy his customers' demand. He hopes to further expand his business so that his profits will increase.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products to satisfy his customers' demand.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
У Сергея отличное, большое хозяйство, много теплиц, в них он выращивает помидоры и огурцы. Во дворе очень красивый дом и что больше всего впечатляет- это идеальный порядок. Прошлой осенью благодаря кредиту от КИВА Сергей провел отопление в теплицы и очень этому радовался. Посадил в марте огурцы, недосыпал, топил день и ночь теплицы. Ожидал успеха в раннем сборе урожая. Но через некоторое время обратил внимание, что растения развиваются не очень активно. Решил замерить температуру и оказалось, что земля не достаточно прогрета. Сергей был  обеспокоен, так как огурцы очень теплолюбивые растения и поэтому стал выяснять в чем причина. Он обнаружил, что отопительные шланги в некоторых местах дали течь и поэтому  были наполовину пустыми. Сергей был расстроен, сборка  урожая началась значительно позже и он потерял в прибыли. 

Сейчас Сергей опять обратился  за кредитом в 40 тыс. грн.  для приобретения новых качественных шлангов, а также уголя для отопления. Сергей надеется, что в следующем году у него будет все работать как надо, ведь он так любит порядок!
texts.en:
Sergei owns a sizable business; he has many greenhouses where he grows tomatoes and cucumbers. In the courtyard, he has a beautiful house with impressive cleanliness and order. 

Last fall, thanks to a loan from Kiva, Sergei installed a heating system and greenhouses, and was very happy with them. In March, he planted cucumbers and spent night and day heating the greenhouses. He was expecting a successful harvest, but over time he noticed that the plants were not growing actively. He measured the temperature, and it turned out that the soil was not warm enough. Sergei was concerned because cucumbers are heat-loving plants, so he began to investigate the problem. He discovered that the heating pipes had leaks, and thus were half empty. Sergei was disappointed; the harvest began much later and he lost profit.

Now Sergei is requesting a loan of 40,000 UAH in order to buy new, quality hoses, as well as coal for heating. Sergei is hoping that next year, everything will work correctly -- after all, he loves order!

loans.use: to buy new hoses and coal for heating greenhouses

loans.name: Neng

texts.en:
Neng, 40, is a resident from the Samrong district of Takeo Province. She is married and blessed with three kids. Nowadays, she needs to support only one dependent child who is studying in a local university.  To provide sustenance for her family, she grows dry season rice on three hectares. It is the business that she has been in for 22 years. 

Neng has never worked with with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. Hence, she applies for the first loan to support her son’s tuition, as her son wants to earn a bachelor degree specializing in Civil Engineering. She hopes that she can support the financial demands of her son in timely way, so that her son can pay more attention to studying and get a good grade.

loans.use: To cover tuition fees for her son

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en: Lerma is helping her husband manage their own farm to earn a living. She requested a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer to improve their farm. She always finds ways to support the needs of her five children and also to augment their living. She plans to save a portion of her revenue for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the farm.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр житель села Водяное  в Украине. Он уже много лет выращивает овощи на своем участке, такие как редис, помидоры, кабачки и зелень петрушки. В этом ему помогает трудолюбивая жена и дочь. Александр хороший хозяин, любит свое дело. Он сделал красивый двор около своего дома. Забетонировал дорожки, насадил виноградник и летом в его тени приятно отдохнуть в красивой беседке. 

На огороде у Александра тоже порядок, построены 7 теплиц. За один год он успевает вырастить и собрать три урожая. Он очень серьезно относится к своему бизнесу, узнает что-то новое и старается применить это в своем хозяйстве. В этом году Александр хочет провести отопление в своих теплицах. Он увидел, что  многие знакомые и друзья уже сделали отопление и это очень выгодно. Александр просит предоставить ему кредит на 40,000 гривен. Он планирует начать новый сезон уже в отапливаемых теплицах.

Примечание: на фото Александр со свой женой.
texts.en:
Alexander is a resident of the village of Vodyanoye, in Ukraine.  For many years already, he has been growing vegetables such as radishes, tomatoes, zucchini and parsley on his plot of land.  His hardworking wife and daughter help him run the business.  Alexander is a good farmer and he loves his work.  Next to his house, he has created a beautiful courtyard with a paved driveway, a new vineyard, and a gazebo where it is nice to relax, in the shade, in the summer.

Everything is in order on Alexander's property.  He has built seven greenhouses in which he manages to sow crops and get a harvest three times per year.  Alexander is very serious about his business.  Whenever he learns something new, he tries to apply it to the business.  This year, he wants to install a heating system inside his greenhouses, as he has seen how profitable it has been for many of his friends to install heating systems in their own greenhouses.

Alexander is requesting a loan of 40,000 hryvnia.  He is ready to start a new season in well-heated greenhouses.

Note: In the photo, Alexander is featured with his wife.

loans.use: to purchase and install a heating system for his greenhouses.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.ru:
Любовь очень ответственный, интеллигентный, трудолюбивый человек. Много лет она трудилась в совхозе секретарем, сотрудники ее любили и уважали за доброе, отзывчивое сердце. Сейчас Любовь на пенсии и  теперь  она может  больше времени уделять  своему  домашнему хозяйству. Она выращивает высокорослые помидоры. На огороде она всегда трудилась вместе с мужем, но теперь муж инвалид, у него проблемы с позвоночником, передвигается только с помощью костылей. Любовь очень переживает за мужа и ей  было  бы очень тяжело вести свое хозяйство, но у нее есть помощник, сын с которым  вместе трудятся. 

Благодаря предыдущим КИВА кредитам, вместе с сыном Любовь построила и оборудовала две теплицы. На ее участке еще осталось место для одной теплицы. Чтобы не терять год, Любовь решила обратиться за кредитом в 20,000 грн. и построить на эти деньги дополнительную теплицу. 

Любовь очень любит своих детей, а их у нее трое. Старшие уже самостоятельные, а младший нуждается в поддержке, поэтому она делает все возможное чтобы и младший сын мог начать самостоятельую жизнь.
texts.en:
Lubov is a responsible, intelligent, hardworking person. For many years, she worked as a secretary at a state farm, and was loved and respected by her coworkers for her kind, sympathetic heart.

Lubov is now retired and can devote more time to her home business of growing tall tomatoes. In the past, Lubov worked in the garden with her husband, but he is now handicapped with spine problems and can only move with the aid of crutches. Lubov worries a lot about her husband and it was very difficult for her to continue with her business, but she now gets help from her son and they work together.

Thanks to previous Kiva loans, Lubov and her son built and equipped two greenhouses. There is enough space on her land for one more greenhouse. To avoid losing a year, Lubov decided to request a loan of 20,000 UAH and build the additional greenhouse.

Lubov loves her three children. The oldest are already independent, but the youngest needs support. Lubov is therefore doing all she can to help her youngest son get on his feet.

loans.use: to repair and renovate greenhouses

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is helping her husband on their farm to earn a living. She takes care of her flower garden and sells flowers in their community. Marissa has been doing this for two years and she has been able to provide for the needs of her two children in school. 

Marissa borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase organic fertilizer and a new variety of flower. In the future, she wants to have a comfortable house.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and a new variety of flower

loans.name: Samoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Battambang province, Samoeurn is a married father who is blessed with four children. He is a rice grower with support from his wife. As a couple they can earn up to 33,000 KHR per day to cover the daily food expenses and other necessary expenses in the family.  

This is the second microloan for Samoeurn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has wisely utilized his past loan to sustain his living condition. Now, in a group of three, he is a leader. The total amount of his entire group loan is 3,600,000 KHR, of which 1,200,000 KHR is his loan portion. Samoeurn will spend his entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for his crop. He hopes that he can gain a good yield, better than last year which will better his lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for his crop

loans.name: Rousary Kamil

texts.es: Rousary  es una joven que proviene de padres agricultores, el año 2011 cuando cursaba el penultimo curso vio que su vivienda  estaba ubicado en un buen lugar y que ademas se encontraba en la feria de su comunidad que paulatinamente se fue agrandando y le surgió la idea de poner a la venta aceites para vehiculo, sin embargo no contaba con capital por lo que sus padres a tanta insistencia y compromiso de cuidar del capital le proporcionaron una caja de aceites, a lo que Rousary le sacó provecho no solo se dedico a la venta sinó que tambien hacia ella misma los cambios a los vehiculos, hasta hace un año y algunos meses aproximadamente gira su propio capital sin embargo ella necesita un capital para comprar valdes de aceite para camiones y su engrasadora para hacer crecer su negocio, Rousary estudia por las noches y atiende su actividad economica todos los dias, los siete dias a la semana, tiene la idea de superarse tanto en su pequeño negocio como en su vida profesional, hizo una declaracion muy curiosa dijo "no quiero trabajar para nada, quiero crecer", y este es el tipo de ayuda que necesitan los jovenes Bolivianos una oportunidad para crecer y formar parte de una sociedad de bien.
texts.en:
Rousary is a young woman who comes from a farming family. After completing her penultimate year of school in 2011, she noticed that her home was in a good location near the town market, which was steadily growing. It occurred to Rousary to sell car oil, but she did not have the money to buy any. At her insistence her parents saved the money to buy her a box of oils. Rousary took advantage of this by not only selling the oil but also offering oil changes. She began turning a profit just over a year ago; nevertheless she needs additional capital to purchase oil for trucks and an oil gun, which will help her grow her business.

Rousary studies in the evenings after attending to her business each day, seven days a week. She hopes to get ahead in her business and in her professional life. She made a very interesting statement, "I don't want to work for nothing, I want to grow". This is exactly the type of of help that young Bolivian people need to grow and become part of a good society.

loans.use: to purchase oil containers for trucks and an oil gun

loans.name: Pring's Group

texts.en: Pring is 53 years old and a mother of two children. She is a rice farmer who is able to generate about 41,000 KHR per day to support the needs of her family.  This is the first microloan for Pring’s group consisting of two women with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her requested loan amount is 1,000,000 KHR and her co-borrower is applying for 700,000 KHR. As the leader, Pring will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crop. She hopes that she can boost her crop yield more than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crop

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en:
Adeline is a married woman and has been blessed with two children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She cites seasonality as her major challenge in the business. 

She is requesting for KES 50,000 to boost her kiosk, purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking oil

loans.name: Felix De La Cruz

texts.es:
Felix vive en la ciudad de Nazca, para poder salir adelante trabaja como vigilante de un colegio de su ciudad, Felix labora alrededor de 9 horas al día asimismo tiene un pequeño cultivo de cacao con el cual tiene un dinero extra para los gastos de su hogar; Felix cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable.

Felix está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar cacao al por mayor y de esta manera poder atender el pedido de sus clientes y de esta manera seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una empresa comercializadora de Cacao”.
texts.en:
Felix lives in the city of Nazca.  To move ahead he works as a school watchman in his city.  Felix works around 9 hours a day and also has a small crop of cocoa with which he has some extra money for his home expenditures.

Felix believes that things are going well in his work because he is very responsible.

Felix is thankful for the lenders Kiva and thankful for the help which has allowed him to be able to buy wholesale cocoa seeds so that he can tend to the demand of his clients and therefore continue fighting for his dream of being able to realize his big dream: "Having a commercial cocoa business".

loans.use: To buy cocoa seeds

loans.name: Michael John Arturo

texts.es:
Michael es un hombre de 29 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Michael no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Michael trabaja como agente de seguridad en un centro medico de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Michael se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizará el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea refaccionar el techado y reforzar las paredes.
texts.en: Michael is 29 years old, single, living in the city of Ica with his parents and siblings. He is hard working, enthusiastic and possesses a great desire to get ahead. Unfortunately, because of the lack of economic resources and because he has had to work, he has not been able to pursue his studies. Michael currently works as a security agent in a medical clinic in the city. He works every day for approximately ten hours and says that things are going well for him because of his dedication and hard work. Michael is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help he will be able to improve his house. He hopes to refurbish the roof and reinforce the walls.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina is a first-year student of AUCA, department of European Studies. Here is her story.
“For more people the future is uncertain. There are lots of choices in future and one of them that incredibly impacts on our life is what we choose for our career. Maybe it can be a difficult decision to make, but every person is responsible for one's future career. I chose the European Studies department, because here I can learn about European culture, politics, history and people, so that I could apply it to my home country. What attracts me the most is the life of the youth in Europe. I can also improve my language skills in this department. AUCA gives lots of opportunities to its students, one of which is financial aid. So, I would like to take this opportunity and apply for Kiva loan. It will allow me to cover my tuition fees.”

loans.use: To pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Vien's Group

texts.en:
Vien was born in 1990. She lives with her family in Dong Anh, Hanoi. She has a newborn child and her husband also works. She sews clothing to earn a living. She earns about 3,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for 2 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work is the lack of capital to buy material to sew. Her dream is to grow her business and buy more equipment for her house. This loan is one of the steps to help her reach this dream. Vien is a hard-working woman. She is also passionate about her job. This is the first time she has participated in SEDA's credit program. In this cycle, she would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy sewing materials. She has always wanted to expand her business and have a better life in the future.

Other members who are part of Vien's group include the following:

Chung was born in 1959. She has two children. She has a karaoke business. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to buy more equipment for rooms in her karaoke business.

Tang was born in 1956. She has two children. She has a grocery store. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to sell groceries.

Toan was born in 1962. She has a child. She raises chicken to pay for living. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to raise chickens.

Huyen was born in 1981. She has two children. She raises pigs to pay for living. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to raise pigs.

Nghia was born in 1972. She has two children. She sews clothing to pay for living. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to sell vegetables.

Sau was born in 1958. She has three children. She sells eggs to pay for living. She wants to borrow 10682,000 VND to sell eggs.

loans.use: to buy material to sew.

loans.name: Deisy Leonor

texts.es:
Picoaza consta en los libros como uno de los pueblos aborígenes parte de la cultura Manteña, esta parroquia urbana situada a tan solo diez minutos de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita está llena de muchas historias, aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal María Asunción.
En este lugar vive la señora Deisy. Tiene 49 años de edad, está separada y tiene tres hijos de 24, 19 y 18 años de edad todos viven con ella los menores estudian en universidad. 
Doña Deisy además de ser una gran madre para ganarse la vida y la de sus hijos después de que se separo puso un negocio de internet en su casa, allí también vende  útiles escolares, helados, sodas y bocadillos de picar, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 21h00,  tiene muchos clientes como por ejemplo estudiantes que llegan  a hacer consultas o trabajos en las maquinas, lleva más de tres años con este negocio y  poco a poco lo ha ido ampliando, empezó con el servicio de internet y ahora tiene una papelería bien surtida también.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar útiles escolares y pagar el sevicio del internet. Lleva más de dos años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con cada crédito. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean profesionales
texts.en:
Picoaza is described in books as one of the villages of the indigenous Manteña culture.  It is just 10 minutes from the city of Portoviejo, which is the capital of the Manabi province of Ecuador.  It is full of history and is the place where the members of the María Asunción communal bank meet every 2 weeks.  This is also where Deisy lives.  Deisy is 49 years old, separated, and has 3 children of ages 24, 19, and 18.  The youngest two live with her still and are college students.

In addition to being a great mother to her children (having to earn a living for herself after separating from her husband), Deisy has an internet cafe business in her house.  She also sells school supplies, ice cream, soda, and spicy snacks.  She works every day from 8:00 am to 9:00 pm.  She has many customers, including students that go there to meet together or do homework on the computer.  She has had this business for more than 3 years and has been expanding it little by little.  She started out with internet service and now also sells paper and many other school supplies.

This loan will be used to buy school supplies and also pay for internet service.  She has been with this communal bank for more than 2 years and likes it because she gets help with every loan.  Her dream is to allow her children to obtain professional jobs.

loans.use: buy school supplies and pay for internet service.

loans.name: Carmen Mercedes

texts.es:
Picoaza consta en los libros como uno de los pueblos aborígenes parte de la cultura Manteña, esta parroquia urbana situada a tan solo diez minutos de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita está llena de muchas historias, aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal María Asunción.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada  y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 16, 4 y 1 años de edad, el mayor  estudia en colegio.  El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Carmen es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a su esposo con los gastos que genera el hogar  se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja todos los  días de dos a tres horas al día, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad por lo cual ya cuenta con muy buena clientela que siempre le compran sus productos. 
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa para entregar. Lleva 5 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda para su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Picoaza is described in books as one of the villages of the indigenous Manteña culture. It is just 10 minutes from the city of Portoviejo, which is the capital of the Manabi province of Ecuador. It is full of history and is the place where the members of the María Asunción communal bank meet every 2 weeks. This is also where Carmen lives.  She is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children (ages 16, 4, and 1).  Her oldest studies in high school.  Her husband is an entrepreneur.

Carmen is house-wife who also works to obtain her own income and help her husband with the household expenses.  She works selling clothes through a catalog and also selling Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories).  She sells door to door and works 2-3 hours a day.  She sells her products on credit and charges for her sales every week.  She has been doing this for more than 15 years and for this reason has a very good clientele that always buys her products.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and clothes to deliver door-to-door.  This is her 5th loan with her communal bank and she likes it because the loans are of great help to her business.  Her dream is to give her children a better life.

loans.use: buy perfume, creams, makeup, and clothes.

loans.name: Fridda Paola

texts.en: Fridda dreams of becoming an economist. To achieve her goal, Fridda has enrolled in the Universidad Juan Misael Saracho. With this loan, Fridda plans to buy her schoolbooks. Up until now, she has been managing to get by without them but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies, she feels she will be able to get better grades. In addition to her responsibilities at school, Fridda currently works 40 hours a week and earns $11 a day. With a career in economics, she expects to earn $20 a day, a substantial increase from before. With three other siblings, Fridda is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. Fridda hopes to be able to contribute towards her family's income in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks

loans.name: Alfonsina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Asunción se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Alfonsina, tiene 58 años,  está casada y de esta relación tuvo dos hijos pero uno falleció el que aún le queda ya es mayor de edad e independiente. El esposo es profesor.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y de sabanas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta,  empezó su negocio con el primer crédito que recibió del Banco, trabaja cuatro días a la semana y los fines de semana cobra ya que deja a crédito. Para poder surtir su negocio tiene que viajar hasta las ciudades de Guayaquil y Quito cada 15 días. En la actualidad lo que más vende es ropa de temporada como trajes de baño, bermudas y gorras. También está vendiendo bisuterías y gafas sobretodo de damas.
Este crédito es para comprar sabanas,  gafas, bisutería y ropa de todo tipo. Ella es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con un crédito pudo empezar su negocio. Su sueño es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The María Asunción communal bank meets every 2 weeks in the Picoaza village, which is near the city of Portoviejo.  This area is well known as a commercial area, for the traditional festivals of Saint Pedro and Saint Pablo, and for the happiness of its people.

Alfonsina is 58 years old and lives in Picoaza.  She is married and has 2 children.  One of them passed away but the child she still has is grown and independent.  Her husband is a teacher.

Alfonsina works selling clothes and sheets door-to-door.  She started this business with the first loan that she received via her communal bank.  She works 4 days a week and collects her money on the weekends (since she sells on credit).  In order to stock her store, she has to travel to the cities of Guayaquil and Quito every 2 weeks.  Currently, she is mostly selling seasonal clothes such as bathing suits, shorts, and hats.  She also sells imitation jewelry and primarily women's sunglasses.

This loan is to buy sheets, sunglasses, imitation jewelry, and all kinds of clothes.  She is the founding member of her communal bank and she likes it because she was able to start her business with a loan.  Her dream is to progress and get ahead in life.

loans.use: buy sheets, sunglasses, imitation jewelry, and clothes.

loans.name: Kelian Christian

texts.en: Kelian has always dreamed of becoming a commercial engineer. Kelian is currently attending the Universidad del Valle, working towards his degree in commercial engineering. With this loan, Kelian plans to buy his schoolbooks. Up until now, he has been managing to get by without them but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies, he feels he will be able to get better grades. Kelian currently works 30 hours a week. One of his biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. Currently Kelian earns $17 a day. With a degree in commercial engineering, he expects to earn $49 a day.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks

loans.name: Maria Jhoselyn

texts.en: Maria has always dreamed of becoming a commercial engineer. To achieve her goal, Maria has enrolled in Escuela Militar de Ingeniería. She plans to graduate in July 2016 but without a loan from Vittana she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. With this loan, Maria plans to buy her schoolbooks. Up until now, she has been managing to get by without them but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies, she feels she will be able to get better grades. In addition to her responsibilities at school, Maria currently works 40 hours a week at a store and earns $10 a day. With a career in commercial engineering, she expects to earn $25 a day, a substantial increase from before. With one older sibling attending college already, Maria is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks

loans.name: Brian Cristian

texts.en: Brian dreams of becoming a mechanic. Brian is currently attending the Instituto Ceta, working towards his degree in mechanics. He plans to graduate in December 2014, but without a loan from Vittana, he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. With this loan, Brian plans to purchase his textbooks. As an added expense, textbooks are often not bought to save money. With them, Brian hopes to be able to better understand his subjects. Brian currently works 30 hours a week. One of his biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With one older sibling, Brian is unsure how he will be able to complete his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks

loans.name: Angela Lucia

texts.es:
Ángela es una joven de 26 años de edad, soltera y sin ninguna dependencia la cual trabaja arduamente y con mucho entusiasmo en su pequeño negocio de mini mercadito en el cual vende una variedad de productos que son básicos en el hogar como: papel higiénico, granos básicos ya pesados (frijoles, maíz, arroz), salsa para cocinar, refrescos de botella plástica, etc. que diariamente se consume por cada uno de sus clientes acompañado de una cafetería y un ciber café. Ella tiene un grado de educación secundaria completo graduándose como bachiller en educación y que actualmente no ejerce su profesión por lo que mejor decidió implementar su negocio. El lugar donde tiene ubicado sus diferentes actividades económicas es en la casa de sus padres los cuales la han apoyado en todo lo necesario para que ella pueda superarse en la vida y sus ideas pueda llevarlas a cabo. Su clientela para su ciber café y su cafetería son los alumnos que estudian en la universidad de la zona los fines de semana ofreciéndoles servicios de impresión, fotocopia, golosinas, etc. 
Por lo que ella mediante la demanda de clientela que tiene y agradece a Dios por darle esa satisfacción ha solicitado financiamiento para la compra de insumos como harina de comal, cola lata, jugos naturas, sopas instantáneas, manteca, entre otros que ayudaran a incrementar las ventas y a fortalecer su pequeño mini mercadito.
Sus planes a futuro son los de poder seguir ampliando más sus negocios verlos crecer mediante la compra de más equipo de trabajo y poder hacerlo competitivo en la zona para que el día de mañana sus hijos tengan un mejor bienestar y un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Ángela is 26 years old, single, and with no dependents. She works very hard and enthusiastically in her small business, a mini market, where she sells a variety of basic products for the home, such as: toilet paper, basic grains (beans, corn, rice), sauces for cooking, soft drinks in plastic bottles, etc., things that her customer use every day. She also has a cafeteria and a cybercafé. She completed her secondary education, graduating with a high school diploma in education. She does not currently work in her field, so she decided to open her business. The place where she has her different businesses located is in her parents' house. They have supported her with everything necessary so that she could excel in life and so that she could carry out her ideas. Her customers for the cybercafé are university students who study in the local university on the weekends. She offers them printing and photocopying services, sweets, etc.

She is thankful to God for the customer demand she has and so she requested financing to buy products such as corn flour, colas in cans, Naturas brand juices, instant soups, shortening, and other things that will help her to increase her sales and strengthen her small mini market. 

Her plans for the future are to continue expanding her businesses and see them grow by buying more equipment. She wants to be competitive in the area so that in the future her children will have a better wellbeing and a better future.

loans.use: to buy food products for her mini market.

loans.name: Sopha's Group

texts.en:
Sopha, 31, lives in a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. She is married and has three children; two are still in school while another is too young for school. Sopha has been planting corn while her husband is a fisherman. They have been in this business for ten years.

After the three cycles with VisionFund, she now can earn about KHR 60,000 per day to respond to her family’s needs and manage to save about KHR 15,000 each day for the future needs. Now leading her group to ask for another loan, Sopha wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her family to increase the crop yield so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Sinan

texts.en: Sinan is a mother of four children and a villager from Srey Santhor district of Kampong Cham province. She struggles to earn a living via rice farming on one and half hectares. She has been occupied with this business for ages and it has returned her about US $9 per day. This is not the first loan for Sinan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The successful past loan that she has repaid completely has enabled her to stabilize her living and keep her kids in school. However, the school fee of one of her children, who wants to pursue bachelor's degree majoring in English literature, is getting to be quite a burden, as it is the cost for university’s tuition fee. To overcome this challenge, she has applied for a new loan with VisionFund. Hence, this entire loan portion will cover the school fee for her son. She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To cover the university school fee for her son.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en: Luciana appreciates the previous loan. She comes to you requesting another loan of KES 30,000 to enable her to buy cloth materials, threads and needles for her tailoring business. She thanks Yehu and Kiva.

loans.use: buy cloth materials, threads and needles for her business

loans.name: Kimhour

texts.en: Kimhour, one of the breadwinners in her family consisting of four schoolchildren, is 42 years old and a resident of Kampong Cham province. To make a living, she sells Khmer noodles and manages a vegetable garden. This is the business that she has been in for 25 years. Kimhour, who has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two cycles including this loan, has repaid her past loan with success, which enables her to provide her kids with sufficient food and decent clothes. Moreover, she can keep her kids in school. For this cycle, she is applying for a new loan in order to cover the school fees for her son who wants to hold a bachelor degree in Information Technology.  She hopes that she can support her son's need on time so he can fulfill his dream.

loans.use: To cover the school fees for her son

loans.name: Two In One Group

texts.en:
Mariam, who is in her late 30s, is married with five children. Three of them are at school and the two are still small.  She has been running a poultry business for eight years now.  She works from 6am to 6pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mariam's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use for buying more chicks and chicken feed.  She dreams of opening a shop where she can sell fresh juice from sugar cane.  

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group "Two in One" which has five members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Cheangmei's Group

texts.en:
Aged 28 years, Cheangmei is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She is a mother of one daughter, who is dependent and still in school. She earns a living by working as a tailor, while her husband is a paid worker. Together, she and her husband can earn about KHR 50,000 per day from the current business.

This is the fourth loan for Cheangmei with VisionFund. She has used the third loan wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for another loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fabrics for her tailoring business. She hopes to increase her income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie is 41 and married to a farmer. They are blessed with three school-aged children. She has a hog-raising business and earns a net income of 3,000 PHP every three months. Her profits are spent on the school allowances of her children. Due to financial constraints, she would like a loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP to purchase hog feed and hogs to raise. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow to become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed and hogs to raise

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en:
Chreb, 34, lives with her husband and two children in a rural village of the Dambae district, Cambodia. To feed the family, Chreb and her husband earn a living as farmers. They have been growing rice and cassava for 10 years, earning about 30,000 KHR per day for their family’s needs.
This is Chreb’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and her group has only two members, who have just joined with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Chreb wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to grow more crops so as to earn a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Nat's Group

texts.en: Nat, age 50, is a married mother blessed with two children. She lives in Kampong Cham province where cassava and rubber plantations are the well-known products. Besides these businesses, she also manages rice farming to supplement her income. She has been involved in this business since she was 20 years old. This is not the first loan for Nat and her co-borrower. Her past loan, which she has repaid completely, has enabled her to provide decent meals for her family and improve her standard of living. Now, she is applying for a new loan to support her current business, and she is a group leader. For Nat, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy latex bowls to collect latex from her rubber plantation and to buy fertilizer as well as pay a weeding fee for her cash-crops. She hopes to gain a good yield from her business so she can expand her business to generate more income to better her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy latex bowls and fertilizer and pay a weeding fee for her cash-crops

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en:
Sorn, 56, is married. Her family lives in a house with a thatched roof located in Battambang province’s Ek Phom district. The main sources of her family’s income are from making snacks for selling while her husband is a paid worker. She has been running her business for 15 years, earning about KHR 40,000 per day and she is able to save about KHR 20,000 each day. 
Sorn received her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, four cycles ago and has effectively used it to sustain her family’s business, and support her family’s needs. Now she is leading her group to seek another loan. Sorn, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy ingredients for making snacks. She hopes to earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Neng's Group

texts.en: Neng, a 51-year-old mother of five children from Kampong Cham province, is a local farmer who does rice farming on one hectare as the main source of income and raises pigs for supplementary income.  This is the business that she has occupied for ages and nowadays it returns her about 91,400 KHR per day. Now, Neng and her joint borrower are seeking for the first time loan of 1,000,000 KHR and 700,000 KHR, respectively from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more pigs for raising and to buy necessary materials to support her rice farming. She hopes that she can gain a good income from her businesses so as she can relieve her family’s burden.

loans.use: To buy more pigs for raising

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for ladies wear, men's jeans, jackets and shoes

loans.name: Sovat's Group

texts.en: A mother in her late 30s residing in Kampong Cham province, Sovat is a rice grower who is able to generate about 44,200 KHR on average per day to support her entire household consisting of three children. Sovat and the other two borrowers in her group are new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion on buying potash for her crops. She hopes that this purchase will boost her crops and earn her a good profit.

loans.use: To buy potash for her crops

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sida

texts.en: Sida is a resident of Kampong Thom province. She is 43 years old and has five children. To support her family, she makes a living selling pork and farming rice. Sida is quite new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is applying for her first loan to cover tuition for her son who wants to pursue a bachelor degree in Electronics Engineering. She hopes that she won't need to worry about financial support for this academic skill.

loans.use: To cover tuition for her son

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Kampong Svay District

loans.name: Liny's Group

texts.en:
Liny is aged 40 and married. She has six children, three of whom are dependent on the family and are still in school. Living in a village of the Moung Russey district, Liny is a teacher and also buys and sells pigs. Liny has been in the pig business for ten years.
This is the eighth loan for Liny’s group with VisionFund. Liny completely repaid the past three loans, which has enabled her family to have enough food. Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan to buy more piglets and to use a portion of it to buy pig feed. She hopes to make more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy more piglets

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: A local villager from Kampong Cham province, Sok is 53-years-old and a married mother blessed with one daughter who is in school.  To deal with the daily cost of living, she sells sweets whereas her husband sells sacks to earn additional income. This is the business that she has been with for about 20 years. Including this loan, she is a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan with success and it has enabled her to keep her daughter in school until she graduated secondary school. Now, her daughter wants to pursue her dream of becoming an accountant. To support her daughter’s dream, she decided to take a new loan in order to pay for tuition fee for an accounting major for her daughter. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay the tuition fee for an accounting major for her daughter.

loans.name: Cheat

texts.en:
Cheat, aged 31, is married and a loving mother of three dependent children. She currently lives with her spouse and children in Kompong Cham province, where she operate agribusinesses; rice farming and pig raising. The income from these businesses is barely enough to cover her daily living costs, so her husband works in Phnom Penh as a driver to provide enough for their basic needs.

As this is her first loan cycle, Cheat is taking out a loan in the sum of KHR 700,000 to purchase five piglets to place in her pigpen at home. Upon maturing, Cheat will sell her fattened pigs into the local markets of the province, and she hopes to make additional income from this investment as a result of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase five piglets to place in her pigpen at home.

loans.name: Kyabasenja Kweterana Group

texts.en:
Charles is aged 50 years and married with five children aged 17, 15, 13, 10 and 8. He pays tuition for all of them, and he lives with other two dependents who are relatives. 
Charles operates a primary school and has been doing this since 2012 to earn a living and develop the community.
Charles has approached UGAFODE for a loan of UGX 600,000 in order to construct another classroom block and hopes to pay back the loan well using proceeds from the school.
Charles has a dream of developing his school to be one the leading schools in the Kibaale district.
He has challenges of poor pupils who cannot afford school fees, and inadequate facilities. He is hopeful that the school will develop if he continues to get financial assistance from Kiva lenders through UGAFODE.

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice, who lives in Eldoret, is a farmer who produces dairy milk, eggs and crops, which are her main source of income. She has been farming for 19 years. She loves farming and the most enjoyable part is milking her cows, while her biggest challenge is how to eradicate pests and diseases affecting her livestock. She chose Juhudi Kilimo to finance her project because they cater for the needs of small scale farmers like her. This loan will help her buy poultry which will increase her egg production and sales, and this will lead to an improvement in her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Phorn's Group

texts.en: Originally from a village of Banteay Meachey province’s Moungkul Borey district, Phorn is aged 60 years and married with two children. For the last 40 years, she and her husband have been farming rice and making baskets. She and her husband can earn about 32,000 KHR per day. Phorn has been a member of VisionFund for five cycles already and she wisely and successfully used the past loan to make her living condition better. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on buying bamboo for making baskets. She hopes this loan will enable her to extend her farmland to increase her rice farming production to make more rice to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Narin's Group

texts.en:
Narin, 43, is married and lives with her family in a village of the Thmor Koul district. She has eight children, five of whom are still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice for seven years and supplementing the income by working as a paid worker. The current business earns her family about 26,000 KHR per day. 
There are two members in Narin’s group and they are both in their fourth loan cycle with VisionFund. Narin, who is the leader, is leading her group to apply for a loan. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes to increase her family’s income from her current business so as to make a better living and keep her daughters in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 70 years old. He is a father of one child and has been in the farming for the past 25 years. He would like to use Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production, he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for more toys, clothing clips and cosmetics

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es:
Elvis es un hombre de 43 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica,en el distrito de Parcona, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Elvis no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Elvis trabaja como pintor desde hace muchos años, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Elvis se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá comprar una escalera, la cual le servirá de mucho para realizar sus labores como pintor, así pues Elvis seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Elvis is a 43-year-old man. He is single and lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Parcona. He is very hard-working and enthusiastic, and he strives to get ahead. Unfortunately Elvis was not able to study towards a profession due to a lack of economic resources and because he needed to work. 

On his own initiative, Elvis has worked as a painter for many years. He works every day for approximately ten hours and he thinks it is going well because of his dedication and effort.

Elvis is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to buy a ladder, which will be of great help to his work as a painter. Elvis will thereby continue working and striving to achieve his great dream of having his own house.

loans.use: to purchase a ladder

loans.name: Virginia Del Pilar

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce, que son muy visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Esperanza.
En este lugar vive la señora Virginia, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, la menor aun vive con ellos. Su esposo es médico.
Doña Virginia es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y sentirse útil e independiente se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo, zapatos, carteras, entre otras cosas,  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ella sale a recorrer por la localidad con sus productos o también vende en su casa, hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando le llega mercadería, esta se la envían desde los Estado Unidos. Tiene más de 6  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito para contar con recursos propios sin depender de su marido y que sus ganancias las invierte en comprar más mercadería e ir ampliando su negocio. Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, carteras y varios productos más que vende. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The members of the ‘Nueva Esperanza’ [New Hope] communal bank meet once a fortnight in the city of Santa Ana. The city is known for its lovely scenery and its beautiful freshwater swimming areas, which are visited by a lot of tourists. Virginia, age 60, lives in this place. She is married, and they have four adult children. The youngest daughter still lives with them. Her husband is a doctor. 

Virginia is a housewife and in order to have her own income and to feel useful and independent, she sells clothes, shoes, purses and other items from catalogues. She sells door to door by going around the area with her products. She also sells at her house, where her customers visit when her merchandise arrives.The merchandise is sent from the United States. She has been engaged in this business activity for over six years, and it is going very well for her. 

Virginia is taking out another loan so she can have money of her own without depending on her husband. She will invest her profits in buying more merchandise and continue increasing her business. This loan is to buy clothes, shoes, purses, and various other products which she sells. She has been in her communal bank since it started. She likes it because the payments are easy to make. Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, purses, and various other products.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor tiene 47 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, con mucho esfuerzo logro iniciar su negocio de venta de ropa como recorredora, con lo cual tiene ingresos para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Flor esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá mercadería como polos, short, ropa interior para niños, damas y caballeros, ya que se acerca la campaña de navidad y de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un local propio para su negocio y darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Flor, 47 years old, lives in the city of Ica, and with great effort she managed to start her business of selling clothes door-to-door.

Flor is very thankful with Kiva Lenders because thanks to this help she will be able to buy merchandise such as polo shirts, shorts, lingerie, and clothes for children, women and men. Since the Christmas holidays are coming up, she will increase her income and continue to work towards achieving her greatest dream: have a place to open her business and offer professional careers to her children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like shorts, polo shirts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Fathiddin

texts.ru: Фатхиддин родился в 1987 года. Он живет и работает в столице Таджикистана. Фатхиддин женат, и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка, которому 2 года. Фатхиддин после окончания средней школы в 2005 году поступил в университет по специальности Права и налог. Он окончил успешно в 2011 году. После окончания средней школы он обустроился на работу. Он работает юристом в государственном учреждении. Фатхиддин для того, чтобы расширить своё знание поступил в Национальный Университет Таджикистана на Юридический факультет. Он учится в заочное отделение. Он не имеет достаточно денег, чтобы оплатить за учебный договор в университете, так как его жена домохозяйка и Фатхиддин единственный кормилец в семье. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Fathiddin was born in 1987. He lives and works in the capital of Tajikistan. Fathiddin is married and is raising one child who is two years old. After graduating from secondary school in 2005, Fathiddin enrolled in a university which specialized in Law and Taxes. He graduated in 2011. After graduating, he found a job for himself. He works as a lawyer in a government agency. In order to expand his knowledge, Fathiddin enrolled in the National University of Tajikistan in the Law department. He is studying in the correspondence department. He does not have enough money to pay for his university tuition as his wife is a homemaker and Fathiddin is the only provider in his family. He is requesting a loan to pay for his university tuition. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: To pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: Everilda Asuncion

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres De Lucha se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Everilda, tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 9 y 6  años de edad, ambos estudian en escuela. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. 
Doña Everilda con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder darles lo necesario a sus hijos, se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, además cuida a un sobrino recién nacido pero solo por horas cuando está desocupada, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local.  Trabaja tres a cuatro días por semana, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual saca adelante a sus pequeños.
Este crédito es para comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  dos años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños  son darles lo mejor a sus hijos
texts.en:
The Mujeres De Lucha communal bank meets once a fortnight in the Picoaza parish of the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for being a busy business centre as well as for its traditional festivals of St. Peter and St. Paul and for the happy nature of its people. Everilda lives here. She is 28 years old and is a single mother with 2 children aged 9 and 6 who are both at school. She lives with her parents. 

In order to earn her own money so she can give her children what they need, Everilda earns a living selling all types of clothing and at times when she is not busy she also looks after a nephew who was born recently. She sells door-to-door and also from her home where she has a small shop. She works 3 or 4 days a week, giving her customers credit and collecting the money every fortnight. She goes to Guayaquil to buy merchandise whenever she needs to. She has been doing this work for 8 years so she can bring up her little ones.

The loan is to buy more clothing such as trousers, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing. She has been in the communal bank for 2 years and she likes it because of the help they give them with the loans. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Subhon

texts.ru: Субхон с детства всегда мечтал поступить в университет и получить высшее образование. Он родился в 1992 года. Субхон в средней школе учился успешно. Он 4 года назад поступил в Национальный Университет Таджикистана и таким образом осуществил свою детскую мечту. Он данный момент является студентом 4 курса. Он учится по специальности историка. Субхон после окончания университета хочет работать преподавателем истории. Субхон не женат. Он обратился в ИМОН с целью получения займа. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: From childhood Subhon always dreamed of attending university and receiving a higher education. He was born in 1992. Subhon did well in secondary school. Four years ago, he enrolled in the National University of Tajikistan and therefore fulfilled his childhood dreams. He is currently a fourth-year student. He studies in the history department. After graduation, Subhon wants to work as a history teacher. Subhon is unmarried. He turned to IMON to take out a loan. He is requesting a loan to pay for his university tuition. He relies on your generosity.

loans.use: To pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: María Hiralda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres De Lucha se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 42 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos todos mayores de edad pero que aún viven con ella.
Doña María con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante sola desde hace mas de 14 años se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa donde tiene unas  vitrinas para mostrar su mercadería. Trabaja tres a cuatro días por semana, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  4 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir vendiendo su mercadería para salir adelante
texts.en:
The Mujeres De Lucha communal bank meets once a fortnight in the Picoaza parish of the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for being a busy business centre as well as for its traditional festivals of St. Peter and St. Paul and for the happy nature of its people. María lives here. She is 42 years old and is separated. She has 3 adult children who still live with her.

In order to earn her own money so she can get on in life on her own, she has earned a living for the last 14 years selling all types of clothing. She sells door-to-door and also from her home where she has some display cabinets to show off her merchandise. She works 3 or 4 days a week, giving her customers credit and collecting the money every fortnight. She goes to Guayaquil to buy merchandise once a fortnight or once a month depending on what she needs. 

María will use this loan to buy more clothing such as trousers, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing. She has been in the communal bank for 4 years and she likes it because of the help they give her with the loans. Her dream is to continue selling her clothing to make progress in life.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing

loans.name: Hul's Group

texts.en: Hul is aged 34 and a villager from the Ponhea Krek district of the Kampong Cham province.  She is a rice and cassava grower and a mother of two dependents children. Nowadays, she is able to earn about 30,000 KHR per day from the current business that she has had for several years. She has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before and she and her joint borrower are seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR and 200,000 KHR, respectively. As the leader, she will spend her entire portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for both of her cash crops. She hopes to increase her crop yield and obtain a good selling price.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her both cash crops (rice and cassava).

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Hamroz

texts.ru: Хамроз студент 4 курса. Ему 22 года. Хамроз учится в Российско-Таджикском Славянском Университете. Хамроз учится по специальности филолога. Он учится хорошо и отлично. Хамроз имеет большой интерес к изучению иностранных языков. Он изучает русский, английский, немецкий языки. Ему легко удается изучать языки. Он мечтает изучать французский язык. Отец Хамроза Султонмурод работает в институте искусств. Султонмурод не в состоянии помочь сыну, чтобы оплатить за учебный договор. Хамроз запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Hamroz is a fourth-year student. He is 22 years old. Hamroz studies at the Russian-Tajik Slavonic University. Hamroz studies in the philology department. He is doing very well there. Hamroz is very interested in the study of foreign languages. He is learning Russian, English and German. It's easy for him to successfully learn languages. He dreams of learning French. Sultonmurod, Hamroz's father, works in an Institute of the Arts. Sultonmurod is not in a position to help his son pay for his university tuition. Hamroz is requesting a loan to pay for his university tuition. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: Virginia Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres De Lucha se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Virginia, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos  de 8 y 6 años de edad los mismos que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Virginia junto con el esposo se dedican a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, mientras ella  recorre la ciudad el esposo se desplaza a otras ciudades donde vende su mercadería, ellos dejan a  crédito a sus clientes  y cobran cada ocho o quince días.
