Su mercadería  la van a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días y a veces hasta por semana cuando tienen muchas ventas, llevan más de 10 años dedicados al comercio y les va bastante bien, esta es la forma que ellos tienen de ganarse la vida honradamente. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  más de 6 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un pequeño almacén en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The Mujeres De Lucha Community Bank meets every fifteen days in the parish of Picoaza of the city of Portoviejo. It is known for being a very commercial area, for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo festivals, and for how happy its residents are.

Señora Virginia lives here. She is 26, married, and has two children aged eight and six, who study at school. Her husband is a trader. With her husband, Virginia makes a living selling different kinds of clothing from door to door. While she goes around the city, her husband travels to other cities to sell their merchandize. They let their customers pay on credit, and they collect the money every eight to fifteen days. They go and buy their goods in Guayaquil every fifteen days, sometimes even once a week when they have a lot of sales. They have been in this business for over ten years, and it's going well.This is the way they can earn an honest living.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandize, such as trousers, blouses, shirts and children's' clothing. She has been a member of the Community Bank for over six years, and she likes it because of the support she gets from the loans. Her dream is to have a small grocery store in the city centre.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, shirts and children's' clothing.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman.  She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, she has operated a tailoring business making school uniforms and suits for both men and women. Her challenge in the business is seasonality. She dreams of establishing a dress-making school in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase fabric, sewing thread and needles for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, sewing thread and needles for the business.

loans.name: Latofat

texts.ru: Латофат жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она родилась в 1974 года в семье простого рабочего. Она после окончания средней школы не имела возможности поступить в университет и таким образом, она осталась без высшего образования. Латофат вышла замуж и родила 5 детей. Латофат много лет не работала, так как занималась воспитанием детей. Ее муж Муин данное время находится в Российской Федерации. Он там зарабатывает разнорабочим. Латофат уже несколько лет работает поваром в школе. Она готовит очень вкусно. Латофат хочет открыть столовую. Она хочет готовить и продать местным жителям национальные блюда. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 долларов США для покупки продуктов питания, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Latofat is a joyful and hardworking woman. She was born in 1974 into a simple, blue-collar family. After graduating from secondary school, she did not have the opportunity to attend university and consequently, she was left without a higher education. Latofat got married and gave birth to 5 children. Latofat has not worked for many years as she was busy raising her children. Her husband, Muin, is currently in the Russian Federation. He earns money as an unskilled laborer there. For several years already, Latofat has worked as a cook in a school. She cooks very well. She wants to open a café. She wants to cook and sell Tajik food to local residents. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 USD to buy food products to organize her new business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy food products for organizing her new café business.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana es una joven de 22 años, la cual vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, trabaja como azafata en un casino de su ciudad y con el ingresos de este humilde trabajo puede salir adelante y poder estudiar una especialización para cajeros; Liliana cree que le va bien en su empleo porque es responsable y puntual.

Liliana esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una moto para poder movilizarse ya que vive en una zona alejada y de esta manera poder gastar menos en movilidad, de esta manera el seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Liliana is 22 years old and lives in the city of Chiclayo. She works as a hostess in a casino in her city and with the income from her modest job she is able to get on in life and study a specialised course for tellers. Liliana thinks her work is going well for her because she is responsible and punctual.

She is grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help they have given her she will be able to buy a motorbike for getting around on, since she lives in a remote area and this means she will be able to spend less on travelling expenses. She will then be able to continue working towards making her big dream of going to university a reality.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en: Oun is 54 years old and a married mother of three children. For the sake of her family, she does rice farming and sells desserts as the main sources of income which is about 39,000 KHR per day.  This is Oun's second loan and her fellow group member's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has fully repaid, has enabled her to buy a buffalo to support her rice farming business. Now, she and her co-borrower are seeking a loan for the same amount of 1,000,000 KHR each.  As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and other ingredient to make desserts for resale. She hopes that she can earn more income than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer; and ingredients to make desserts for resale.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Teresa Del Jesús

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres De Lucha se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Teresa, tiene 70 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 11 hijos todos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella. El marido es comerciante. 
Ella y su esposo se dedican al comercio, mientras ella vende en su casa frutas como naranjas, guineos, el esposo se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres en el mercado central, ellos muy de mañanita salen al mercado de mayoristas a abastecerse de productos y después de esto ella le ayuda a su marido a instalar su puesto en el mercado para luego ir a su local que está ubicado en su casa donde ella vende sus frutas. Su esposo lleva más de 35 años con su negocio y  ella recién hace 5 años puso su negocito en el cual se gana algo por su cuenta.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar frutas y legumbres para su negocio y el de su marido. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son tener una tienda de víveres bien surtida.
texts.en:
The Mujeres De Lucha communal bank meets once a fortnight in the Picoaza parish of the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for being a busy business centre as well as for its traditional festivals of St. Peter and St. Paul and for the happy nature of its people. Teresa lives here. She is 70 years old and is in a relationship with a partner with whom she has 11 children. They are all adults and one still lives with her. Her husband is a trader.

Teresa and her husband are in business and while she sells fruit such as oranges and bananas from her home, her husband sells fruit and vegetables at the central market. They set out very early in the morning to go to the wholesale market to stock up on produce and then she helps her husband to set up his market stall before returning to the small shop in her home where she sells her fruit. Teresa's husband has been in this business for 35 years and she set up her small stall 5 years ago so she could have some income of her own.

Teresa will use the loan to buy fruit and vegetables for her own business and her husband's. She has been in the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because the loans help them a lot. Her dream is to have a well-stocked provisions shop.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the costs of a specialized course.

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en:
Phat is aged 43 and married with three children. Her family lives in a village of the Moung Russey district of the Battambang province.  She and her husband earn a living by growing sugarcane and raising pigs while her husband is a paid worker. Engaging in these businesses for 10 years, she is able to earn about 33,000 KHR per day to support the family.
Phat has been with VisionFund for three cycles while her group member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is forming a group to apply for another loan. As the leader, Phat is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to buy more piglets. She hopes to earn more income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Dy's Group

texts.en: Dy, 29 years old, is a villager from the Tbaung Khmum district of the Kampong Cham province and is one of the breadwinners in her family consisting of two dependent children.  To provide sufficient food for her children, she can earn more income through rice farming and as a paid worker at a construction site.  She has been involved in her current business for several years. This is the first microloan for Dy and her co-borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and they are requesting a loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop and to buy necessary materials to support her occupation. She hopes to gain more income from her business as well as to get a high salary from her job.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop and necessary materials to support her occupation.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois Bolo Bokk Jom est créé le 29 mars 2013; il est composé de quarante cinq femmes qui sont au cycle 2 . Elles habitent le même village et ont comme activités principales le maraîchage, l'élevage et le petit commerce.

Madame Khady est la présidente; elle est âgée de 55 ans . Elle est mariée mère de six filles.Elle mène une activité de petit commerce et a une bonne expérience de plus de 10 ans dans ce domaine.Elle est debout sur la photo à droite et a levé la main.

Elle achéte du sucre, des poissons séchés, des crevettes séchées qu'elle revend en faisant du porte à porte. Elle n'a pas de place fixe, elle est ambulante.

Elle envisage avec son prêt acheter pour 25000 F de crevettes séchées, 15000 F de poissons séché et du sucre pour une valeur de 30000 F et espère se faire ainsi beaucoup de revenus à la vente.Son activité marche bien dans son village et les environs.


Avec ses bénéfices, elle compte renforcer son épargne afin de bénéficier d'un prêt plus élevé et aussi avoir son autonomie financière.
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois Bolo Bokk Jom was established on March 29th, 2013. It is made up of forty-five women who are seeking their second loan. They live in the same village and their main business is growing vegetables, raising cattle, and retail.

Mrs. Khady, age 55, is the president of the group. She's married and the mother of six girls. She runs a retail business and has more than ten years of experience in this field. In the photograph, she's standing on the right, raising her hand. 

She buys sugar, dried fish and dried shrimps, that she resells door-to-door. She's a traveling saleswoman and doesn't have a fixed location.

With her loan, she intends to buy dried shrimps (for XOF 25'000), dried fish (for XOF 15'000), and sugar (for XOF 30'000). She hopes to increase her sales and income. Her business is doing well in her village and its surroundings.

With her profits, she intends to bolster her savings in order to get a higher loan and achieve financial autonomy.

loans.use: to buy dried fish, dried shrimps, and sugar

loans.name: Angélica Patricia

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.
En este lugar vive la señora Angélica, tiene 20 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 5 años y de  7 meses  la menor. Su hijo mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica. 
Doña Angélica  es una gran ama de casa que a mas de dedicarse al hogar  también se dedica al comercio, compra y vende  adornos y cerámicas,  ella arrienda un  local en el centro de La Pila en el cual vende todo tipo de artesanía hechos en barro y cerámica, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 19h00, ella compra sus productos a artesanos de la zona pero sin terminar, luego ella en las noches o en momentos que está desocupada les da el acabado a las obras para venderlas a mejor precio. Lleva 2  años con su negocio y le ha ido bastante bien.
Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía de todas las formas y modelos para surtir su negocio. Lleva 2 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer  crédito ellos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener su propia local para no pagar arriendos que se le llevan gran parte de las ganancias.
texts.en:
In La Pila, in Montecristi canton, members of the La Pila Community Bank meet every fifteen days. This place is very well known in the province and the country for its rich cultural traditions. You can find a wide variety of handicrafts which are made by its inhabitants following the traditional customs.

Señora Angélica lives here. She is 20 years old, married and has two children aged 5 and 7 months with her husband. Her eldest child studies at school, and her husband works in a factory. 

Angélica is a wonderful housewife, who as well as looking after the home makes a living as a trader. She buys and sells decorations and ceramics. She rents a premises in the centre of La Pila in which she sells all kinds of handicrafts made of clay and ceramics. She works every day from 8am to 7pm. She buys her unfinished products from local artisans. Then, at night or when she gets some spare time, she finishes the works to sell them at a higher price. She has had this business for two years and it has been very successful.

This loan is to buy more handicrafts of all kinds to stock her business. She has been a member of the Community Bank for two years, and she likes it because it was thanks to her first loan that she was able to start her business. Her dream is to have her own premises so that she doesn't have to pay rent, which uses up a lot of her profits.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Vanna, from the Baray district, Kompong Thom province, is 34 years old and a very hardworking man who is in the business of breeding fish in a small pond adjacent to his house. He is married to Yoer, a village health worker and a pharmacist, and a loving mother of two dependent children. From the current businesses, this couple is able to generate a daily income of KHR 54,400 per day, which they usually use for meals, commodities costs and allowances for their children.

As of now, Vanna would like to ask for a loan in the amount of KHR 2,000,000 to buy medicine for their drug store, which is located in the village, to increase their sales. This fund will allow them to continue improving their current business. In the future, Vanna plans to have a big drug store in his region.

loans.use: to buy medicine for their drug store to increase their sales.

loans.name: Jenny Silvana

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.
En este lugar vive la señora Jenny, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 5 años de edad el cual estudia en escuela. Su esposo es artesano. 
Doña Jenny trabaja de maestra en una escuela de la localidad y realiza el crédito para que su marido lo utilice en su trabajo, el elabora todo tipo de artesanías  y en sus ratos libres ella le ayuda a adornar dichas obras las mismas que una vez terminadas las entregan a varios comerciantes de la zona que tienen locales,  tienen mucha demanda de estos productos y la razón es que ellos realizan un muy buen trabajo por eso los prefieren, ya son más de 8 años que su marido se dedica a esta actividad con la cual saca adelante a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar cerámica, pinturas otra materia prima para elaborar las artesanías. Lleva 3 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener su nombramiento como maestra ya que hasta ahora solo trabaja por contrato.
texts.en:
In a place called La Pila in the Montecristi Canton, the communal bank "La Pila" meets every 15 days.  It is very well-known in the province and country for its rich traditional culture, with a great variety of crafts made by the local people following traditional custom.

This is where Jenny, 23, lives with her husband and five-year-old son who attends school.  Her husband is a craftsman.  Jenny works as a school teacher at the local school and she is requesting the loan for her husband's work.  He makes all kinds of crafts and in her free time, Jenny helps decorate them.  Once the crafts are finished they are delivered to several merchants in the area who have shops.  There is great demand for these products because they are very well crafted and popular.  For over eight years her husband has earned a living for his family from his skill.

This loan is to buy ceramic, paints and other raw materials to make crafts.  Jenny has been a member of the communal bank for three years and she likes the fact that the loans are so helpful.  Her dream is to receive an official teaching appointment since she now only works under contract.

loans.use: To buy ceramic, paints and other raw materials to make crafts.

loans.name: Maï's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe fait partie du banc villageois Doxx Dajé créé le 29 mars 2013; il est composé de vingt huit femmes qui habitent le même village. Elles ont comme activités principales le maraîchage, l'élevage et le petit commerce.

Madame Lika la représentante vedette est âgée de 31 ans . Elle est mariée mère de trois enfants ( deux filles et un garçon).Elle est debout sur la photo à droite et a levé la main.


Elle envisage avec son prêt acheter pour 40000 F de chaussures, des parfums diversifiés pour une valeur de 25000 F afin de renforcer son petit commerce et se faire beaucoup de revenus.


Avec ses bénéfices, elle a ouvert un compte d'épargne pour ses enfants. Elle participe aux dépenses de la famille et aide aussi ses enfants dans leur scolarité.
texts.en:
This group is part of the Banc Villageois Doxx Dajé, which was established on March 29, 2013. It is made up of 28 women who live in the same village. Their main businesses are growing vegetables, raising cattle, and retailing.

Mrs. Lika, age 31, is the featured borrower. She's married and the mother of three children (two girls and one boy). She's the woman standing on the right in the photograph, raising her hand.

She intends to use her loan to buy shoes (for XOF 40'000) and a variety of perfumes (for XOF 25'000) in order to strengthen her retail business and increase her income.

With her profits, she will open a savings account for her children. She participates in covering the family's expenses and also helps her children with their studies.

loans.use: to buy shoes, perfumes, and various other products to resell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma has a variety store and she is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. Her grocery store has been running for more than a decade and is continuously growing. Her loan also helped in sending her children to school. She also has a rental house and a loading station for additional income. 
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Alma hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams to have a good future with her family.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Alberto Gonzalo

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional,  se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.
En este lugar  vive don Alberto, tiene 66 años  de edad, está casado y fruto de esta relación tienen 6 hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de  edad e independientes. Su esposa es ama de casa y le ayuda en su negocio.
El señor Alberto  parar salir Adelante junto a su amada esposa y al ver que ya sus fuerzas no son las mismas para trabajar hace un año atrás emprendió un pequeño negocio de venta de empanadas, corviches, tortillas que su mujer prepara además de jugos, sodas y golosinas. Así ellos logran ganar algo y salir adelante trabajando honradamente y sin tener que depender de nadie.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres, aguas, jugos y sodas. Lleva en el Banco Comunal  más de 4 años y le gusta porque así salen adelante. Sus sueños son tener buena salud
texts.en:
The La Pila communal bank meets every fortnight at the public fountain in the canton of Montecristi. This place is very well known in the province and the country for its rich traditional culture. A wide range of crafts can be found which are made by the locals following traditional customs. Alberto, who is 66 years old, lives here. He is married and he and his wife have 6 children who are independent adults. His wife is a housewife and helps him in his business. 

In order for them get on in life and seeing that his beloved wife doesn't have as much strength now for working, Alberto started up a small business a year ago to sell empanadas, "corviche" [a fish and banana dish] and tortillas made by his wife, as well as juices, fizzy drinks and sweets. By doing this they are able to earn some money and get by in life doing decent work and not having to depend on anyone. 

This loan is to buy provisions, water, juices and fizzy drinks. Alberto has been in the communal bank for more than 4 years and likes it because it helps them to get on in life. His dream is to have good health.

loans.use: to buy provisions, water, juices and fizzy drinks.

loans.name: Johanna Lorena

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres de sus antepasados.
En este lugar vive la señora Johanna, tiene 24 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 5 y 2 años, el mayor estudia en escuela. El marido es maestro de escuela. 
Doña Johanna con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también en su casa que llegan muchos clientes,  tres a cuatro  días a la semana sale a recorrer con sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y que  cobra cada 8 días. Lleva  2 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo y que emplea en los gastos de sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: ropa,  perfumes, cremas, bisutería, entre otras cosas.  Lleva 2 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su negocio el cual le permite salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener un carro para realizar sus recorridos.
texts.en:
Members of the La Pila Community Bank meet every fifteen days in La Pila, in Montecristi province. This place is very well known in the province and the rest of the country for its rich traditional culture, and it has a wide variety of handicrafts made by its inhabitants following the customs of their ancestors.

Señora Johanna is 24 years old and has a partner, with whom she has two children aged 5 and 2, the oldest of whom studies at school. Her husband is a schoolteacher. With the aim of earning her own money and to help her husband with household expenses, Johanna works in trade, selling all kinds of clothing and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories). She is a door to door seller, and also sells her products from home where she is visited by many customers. Three or four days a week, she goes out to sell her products, which she sells on credit and collects the money every eight days. She has been in this business for two years, earning a bit of money to put towards the costs of her children. 

She is going to use this loan to buy more merchandize such as clothing, perfume, creams, jewellery and other items. She has been a member of the Community Bank for two years, and he likes it because she used its loans to open her business, which allows her to move forwards. Her dream is to buy a car to drive around in to sell her goods.

loans.use: Comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas, bisutería, etc.

loans.name: María Eufemia

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña María junto al esposo se dedican al comercio, venden  de adornos y cerámicas,   dos veces por semana ellos compran todo tipo de cerámicas para luego viajar a varias ciudades de la sierra, lugares donde venden sus productos, se quedan una semana en estos lugares entregando y cobrando lo que llevan, luego regresan descansan una semana y vuelven a viajar. Llevan más de 22 años que se dedica a esta actividad y  les ha ido muy bien. Sus productos los compran a artesanos de la zona ya que son los mejores.
Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía de todas las formas y modelos para cumplir con sus clientes. Lleva 5 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda. Sus sueños son tener un local.
texts.en:
Members of the La Pila Community Bank meet every fifteen days in La Pila, in Montecristi province. This place is very well known in the province and the rest of the country for its rich traditional culture, and it has a wide variety of handicrafts made by its inhabitants following the traditional customs.

Señora María lives here. She is 50, married, and has two grown-up, independent children with her husband, who is a trader. María works alongside her husband as a trader, selling decorations and ceramics. Twice a week, they buy all kinds of ceramics, and then they travel around nearby cities to sell their products. They stay in these places for a week, selling their goods, and then go home and relax for a week, before travelling again. They have been in this business for over 22 years, and they've had a lot of success. They buy their products from local artisans, as they are the best. 

This loan is to buy more handicrafts of all kinds to meet her customers' requests. She has been a member of the Community Bank for five years, and she likes it because the loans are extremely useful. Her dream is to have her own shop.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts.

loans.name: Diego

texts.en:
This is Diego, 38 years old and a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. He is single and working hard to continually provide income for his daily expenses.

Diego operates a rug-making business. He mainly offers rugs, from those round palm sized ones to the much larger doormats and other crafts that most rug-makers come up with every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php30,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for his business. 

Diego dreams to be successful both in life and business. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in his business.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en: Ivan is a 33-year-old hardworking married man living in his own house in Kyenjojo,Uganda.  He sells clothes for a living and he started the business to support his farming since the money he earns as a security officer can hardly meet his family needs.  Price fluctuation and the seasonality of the business affects his income and his desire is to own a modern boutique.  Ivan is requesting a loan to buy clothes in anticipation of a big sale during the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes in anticipation of a big sale during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom, 34, is married and lives with her husband and three children in a village of the Moung Russey district of the Battambang province. Her three children are dependent on her; one is still under school-age while another two are in school. She and her husband have been farming rice and sell grocery items, and sometimes they work as paid workers to supplement their income. They have been in this business for ten years, earning about 90,000KHR per day to feed her family but they managed to save about 20,000KHR each day after daily expenses.

Mom’s Group consists of three members who all are female. She is the sixth-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She has successfully repaid her past loans, which have helped her family relieve the financial burden and improve their livelihood. Now, leading her group to apply for another loan, Mom will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on buying more grocery items. She hopes this loan will increase her crop yields and earn more income to make her family’s living condition better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Nekruz

texts.ru: Некруз студент Национального Университета Таджикистана. Некруз родился 1993 года, в горном Таджикистане. Он живет с родителями, в семье их пять человек. Мать Наргис  1968 года рождения, работает в Агентстве борьбе с наркотиками. После школы в 2010, Некруз поступил в Национальный Университет, на юридический факультет отделения юриспруденции, на договорной основе. Сумма ежегодного платежа составляет 8800 сомони. В настоящее время Некруз перешел на третий курс. В университете Некруз не отстает от своих однокурсников, учится на одни четверки и пятерки. В свободное время Некруз занимается спортом, а также любит фотографировать. Некруз запрашивает  займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nekruz is a student at the National University of Tajikistan. Nekruz was born in 1993 in mountainous Tajikistan. He lives with his parents. There are five people in his family. His mother, Nargis, who was born in 1968, works in the Agency to Combat Narcotics. After graduating from school in 2010, Nekruz enrolled in the National University in the law concentration in the case-law department on a contractual basis. His yearly tuition is 8800 somoni. Currently, Nekruz is in his third year. At university, Nekruz keeps up with his classmates, pursuing a degree with high marks. In his free time, Nekruz plays sports and also loves photography. Nekruz is requesting a loan to pay for his university tuition. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: Elida Victoria

texts.es:
Elida es una mujer de 38 años, vive en la ciudad de Huaraz, en el distrito de Carhuaz con su hija, ella es madre soltera, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Elida no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Elida trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de madera, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Elida se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería, como mesas sillas, cómodas y otros, así pues Elida seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Elida, 38, lives in the city of Huaraz in the district of Carhuaz with her daughter.  She is a single, hard-working mother who dedicates all her efforts to providing for her family.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and the need to work, Elida was unable to get professional training.

On her own initiative, Elida runs a small business selling wooden products.  She works about ten hours a day and believes it is going well for her because of her dedication and efforts.

Elida is very grateful to Kiva lenders whose help will allow her to buy more merchandise, such as chairs, chests of drawers and other items.  In this way, She will be able to continue working and striving toward her goal of having her own house.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Tania Karina

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.
En este lugar vive la señora Tania, tiene 35 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen seis hijos de 20, 18, 15, 13, 4 y 2 años edad, todos estudian 3 en colegio y dos en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Tania para ayudarse y ayudar a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica al comercio, ella compra y vende  adornos y cerámicas,  tiene un  local en la vía principal lugar por donde pasan muchas personas y que por lo general pasan comprando algo todos los días, allí vende todo tipo de artesanía, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00. Lleva más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad y que le ha ido muy bien. Sus productos los compran a artesanos de la zona pero semi terminados luego ella le da el acabado necesario para que estén listos para la venta.
Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía de todas las formas y modelos para surtir su negocio. Lleva 2 años en el Banco Comunal  y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho para su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In La Pila in the Montecristi canton the La Pila communal bank meets every two weeks. This place is known in the province and in the country for its rich cultural tradition. A wide variety of handmade crafts can be found there, made by the residents who follow traditional customs. 

Here lives Tania. She is 35, in a common law marriage and had six children from that marriage aged 20,18, 15, 13, 4 and 2 years old. Three of them are in high school and two in elementary school. Her husband is a merchant.

In order to help herself and her husband with the household expenses, she buys and sells decorations and ceramics. She has a locale on a main road where a lot of people go by and in general they buy something every day. She sells all types of handmade crafts and works every day from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. She has been doing this activity for more than 5 years and it has gone very well for her. She buys her products from artisans in the area when they are semi-finished and later she gives them the finish they need so they are ready to sell. 

This loan is to buy more handmade crafts of all types and models to stock her business. She has been in the communal bank for 2 years and she likes it because the loans help her a lot for her business. Her dreams are to keep going ahead.

loans.use: to buy handmade crafts.

loans.name: Nelly Magaly

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.
En este lugar vive la señora Nelly, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos  hijos de 11 y 4 años de edad, ambos estudia en escuela. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Nelly para salir adelante y con sus ganancias ayudar a su esposo se dedica al comercio, ella  tiene un negocio de venta de ropa de todos tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, tres a cuatro veces por semana visita a sus clientes quienes les deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, la mercadería la va a comprar una vez por mes a la ciudad de Guayaquil o  cada vez que necesite, lleva 6 años con este negocio  el mismo que empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco y poco a poco lo ha ido aumentando con los créditos posteriores.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, camisas, entre otras prendas de vestir. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal desde hace más de 6 años y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir incrementando su negocio.
texts.en:
In a place called La Pila in the Montecristi Canton, the communal bank "La Pila" meets every 15 days. It is very well-known in the province and country for its rich traditional culture, with a great variety of crafts made by the local people following traditional custom.

This is where Nelly, 39, lives.  She is married and has two children, ages 11 and 4, who attend school.  Her husband is a driver.

In order for Nelly to earn a living and help her husband with expenses, she works as a merchant.  She sells all kinds of clothing on a door-to-door basis, going out three or four times a week visiting customers, selling on a credit basis and collecting payment every eight days.  She buys the merchandise once a month in the city of Guayaquil or whenever necessary.  This is the same business she started six years ago with her first loan through the communal bank, and little by little she has expanded with subsequent loans.

This loan will be used to buy pants, t-shirts, shirts and other items.  She is a founding member of the communal bank which began six years ago.  She likes the fact that she was able to start her business with the first loan.  Her dream is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: To buy pants, t-shirts, shirts and other items.

loans.name: Iván Ignacio

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.
En este lugar vive el señor Iván, tiene 30 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 2 años de edad. Su esposa es artesana y comerciante. 
Don Iván  junto a su esposa elaboran todo tipo de cerámicas, las mismas que luego de darles el acabado las ponen a exhibición  en su local pues ellos también tienen un local en la vía principal lugar donde muchas personas se dedican a este tipo de  comercio, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00, mientras él se dedica a elaborar sus obras su esposa es la encargada de realizar las ventas en el local y por las noches ella también le ayuda en su labor. Llevan más de 13 años que se dedica a esta actividad y les va muy bien. 
Este crédito es para comprar cerámica, pintura y más materia prima para la elaboración de las artesanías. Lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son mucho más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Sus sueños son tener su propio local ya que donde venden es de su papá.
texts.en:
In La Pila in the Montecristi canton the La Pila communal bank meets every two weeks. This place is well known in the province and in the country for its rich cultural tradition. A wide variety of handmade crafts can be found there, made by the residents who follow traditional customs. 

This is where Iván lives. He is 30 years old, married and has a 2 year old son. His wife is an artesian and merchant. Together with his wife, Iván makes all types of ceramics. After finishing them, they exhibit them in their locale that they have on a main road where a lot of people do this type of business. He works every day from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. While he makes his crafts, his wife is in charge of selling in the locale and at night she helps him in his work.  They have been doing this for more than 13 years and it is going well for them. 
 
This loan is to buy ceramics, paint and more raw materials to make the handmade crafts. He has been in the communal bank for two years and he likes it because the interests are much lower than in other credit institutions. His dreams are to have his own locale, since where they sell belongs to his father.

loans.use: to buy ceramics, paints and more raw materials to make handmade crafts.

loans.name: Thalia Audrey

texts.es:
Thalia es una mujer de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y su pareja, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Thalia se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas.
Por iniciativa propia, Thalia trabaja como camarera en un restaurante de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Thalia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara una refrigeradora para su hogar, así ella y su familia podrán conservar mejor sus alimentos, así pues Thalia seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser una profesional de éxito.
texts.en:
Thalia, 21, lives in the city of Ica in the district of Parcona with her parents and partner.  She is very hard-working and enthusiastic and has a great desire to get ahead.  Thanks to her efforts and support from her parents, Thalis is currently studying Business Administration.

On her own initiative, Thalia works as a waitress at a city restaurant.  She works every day about eight hours and believes it is going well for her because of her dedication and good work.

Thalia is very grateful to Kiva lenders whose help will allow her to buy a refrigerator for her home.  This means she and her family will be able to keep food better.  Thalis wants to continue working and striving toward her goal of being a successful professional.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Erika Katherine

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.
En este lugar vive la señorita Erika, tiene 24 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de los padres, ella está realizando la tesis para graduarse como ingeniera civil.
Doña Erika junto a su familia  se dedican al comercio, compran y venden  adornos hechos en tagua y cerámicas en diversidad de formas y tamaños, ellos  tienen un  local en la vía principal lugar por donde pasan muchas personas que a diario compran en su local, trabaja junto a sus padres porque esto es un negocio familiar y lleva en el lugar por más de 20 años,  gracias a esto ella y sus hermanos han podido estudiar y su familia salir adelante, ellos compran estas obras a artesanos de la zona pero sin pintar luego ellos le dan el acabado adecuado y los venden muy bien. 
Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía de todas las formas y modelos y pinturas para darles el terminado a sus objetos. Lleva  4 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son terminar su carrera y obtener trabajo como profesional.
texts.en:
In La Pila of the Montecristi canton, the La Pila communal bank meets every two weeks. It is known in the province and in the country for its rich cultural tradition. A wide variety of artisanal crafts can be found that are made by its residents, following the traditional customs. 

This is where Erika lives. She is 24 years old, single and lives in her parents' house. She is doing her thesis to graduate as a civil engineer. With her family, Erika works as a merchant. They buy and sell decorations made from tagua and ceramics in different shapes and sizes. They have a locale on the main road where a lot of people go every day to buy. She works with her parents because it is a family business and it has been there for more than 20 years. Thanks to it, she and her siblings have been able to go to school and her family has been abel to get ahead. They buy the items from artisans from the area unpainted and they do the finishing and they sell very well. 

This loan is to buy more crafts in all shapes and types and paint to finish the objects. She has been in the communal bank for 4 cycles and she likes it because the loans help her a lot. Her dreams are to finish her major and get a job in her field.

loans.use: to buy handmade crafts and paint.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge, a sus 55 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una legumbrería que adquirió hace aproximadamente 1 año, ubicado en el parque central del municipio donde reside por lo que es muy concurrido, cuenta con el apoyo de una hermana que le colabora llevando las cuentas y cuando hay mucha afluencia de clientes también apoya atendiendo el negocio; de esta forma genera los ingresos suficientes para aportar a la economía de su hogar. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (frutas y verduras en cosecha), lo que le permitirá tener suficiente inventario para satisfacer la demanda de productos y enfrentar los diferentes desafíos que se le presentan por las alzas inesperadas de los alimentos, lo que le afecta tanto su economía, como la de sus clientes ya que los costos son muy variables e inestables; así tendrá la posibilidad de aumentar las ventas y los ingresos que recibe. Jorge manifiesta que quiere seguir luchando arduamente para sacar su negocio adelante y así poder cumplir el sueño de adquirir un local propio en el que pueda realizar su labor, generando mayor rentabilidad y mejores ingresos, para dar a sus padres un mejor bienestar y condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge is 55 years old and earns a living running his own business, a greengrocer's which he bought approximately a year ago. It is situated in the central park of his home town so it is very busy. He gets help from a sister who does the accounts and when the shop is busy she also helps to serve the customers. In this way Jorge is able to generate enough income to contribute towards his household expenses.

Currently he is asking for the loan to buy wholesale stock (fruit and vegetables in season) which will allow him to have enough stock to meet the demand for products and face the various challenges caused by unexpected rises in food prices. This affects his finances and his customers since the prices are very variable and unstable. By doing this he will be able to increase sales and the income he makes. 

Jorge says he wants to continue working hard to move his business forward and so fulfil his dream of buying his own shop where he can do his business, giving him better profits and better income, so he can improve his parents' wellbeing and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale stock (fruit and vegetables in season).

loans.name: Pablo Bernardo

texts.es:
Pablo es un hombre de 32 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con su madre y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Pablo no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Pablo trabaja como obrero de construcción y adicionalmente brinda servicios de animación de fiestas infantiles como payaso, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y trato amable.
Pablo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará trajes nuevos y pelucas para sus presentaciones, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción de la vivienda de su madre.
texts.en:
Pablo, 32, is single.  He lives in the Parcona district of the city of Ica with his mother and siblings.  He's very hardworking and enthusiastic, and puts all his effort into getting ahead.  Unfortunately Pablo wasn't able to study for a professional career because he lacked the financial resources and had to work.

Pablo works on his own initiative as a construction worker.  He also performs as a clown for children's parties.  He works approximately 10 hours every day and believes it's going well for him because of his dedication and friendliness.

Pablo's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he'll buy new costumes and wigs for his performances.  This way he'll keep on working and making the effort to achieve his big dream of finishing construction on his mother's house.

loans.use: to buy new costumes

loans.name: Eugenio Elifonzo

texts.es:
Eugenio es un hombre de 50 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su hijo, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Eugenio no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Eugenio trabaja como obrero de construcción en diversas edificaciones de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación.
Eugenio se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará maderas y tablas, las cuales utilizará para realizar sus labores de construcción, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a su hijo convertido en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Eugenio, 50, lives with his son in the Imperial district of the city of Cañete.  He's very hardworking and enthusiastic, and dedicates his efforts to getting his family ahead.  Unfortunately Eugenio wasn't able to study for a professional career because he lacked the financial resources and needed to work.

Eugenio works on his own initiative as a construction worker on a variety of buildings in his city.  He works approximately 10 hours every day and believes it's going well for him because of his dedication.

Eugenio's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he's going to buy wood and boards to do his construction jobs.

This way he'll keep on working and making the effort to achieve his big dream of seeing his son become a good professional.

loans.use: to buy boards and wood

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Мухайё в ИМОНе кредитуется повторно. Она честная женщина и имеет хорошее кредитное досье. Мухайё 35 лет. Она замужем. Мухайё вместе с мужем воспитывает 2 детей. Она умеет печь разнообразные кондитерские изделия. Мухайё уже давно мечтала организовать свой бизнес и найти источник дохода, так как она нуждается в деньгах. Мухайё участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она очень хочет открыть кондитерский цех и печь разнообразные торты и печенья. Она не имеет денег, чтобы купить необходимые техники и продукты. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2100 долларов США для покупки холодильника, печки, муки и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на то, что этот займ станет источником нового бизнеса.
texts.en: This is not the first time Muhayo is requesting a loan from IMON. She is an honest woman and has a good credit history. Muhayo is 35 years old. She is married. Muhayo, together with her husband, is raising two children. She knows how to bake various types of pastries. Muhayo has long dreamt of organizing her own business and finding a source of income, as she is in need of money. Muhayo took part in the course "Get Ahead," which was organized by the Association of Businesswomen, and received a certificate. She really wants to open a pastry shop and bake different types of cakes and cookies. She does not have the money to buy the necessary equipment and food products. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 2100 USD to buy a refrigerator, oven, flour, etc. She awaits your kindness and hopes that this loan will become the source for her new business.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator, oven and flour to organize her new bakery business.

loans.name: Noun

texts.en:
Noun, age 50, is a mother of five children residing in Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. Her main sources of income are from rice farming and pig raising businesses. This business has returned her about 42,800 KHR per day. Including this new loan, she is a fourth time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid back her past loan with success. 

The positive impact of her past loan has enabled her to sustain her lifestyle and keep her kids in school. Now, she is seeking 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer for her crop. She hopes that she can boost her crop timely and make more income so that she can grow peppers to earn more profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sokunthea

texts.en:
Sokunthea is 38 years old and a widowed mother who needs to support three schoolchildren. To sustain her living, she does rice farming, sells grocery items and raises cows and pigs as the main sources of income. She has been involved in her current businesses for more than 10 years. 

This is the second loan for Sokunthea with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking a new loan to support her son who wants to continue working toward his bachelor degree, majoring in Civil Engineering. Thus, this loan portion will cover the entire tuition fees for this son. She hopes that he will get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: To cover the entire tuition fees for her son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cover her school's tuition fee.

loans.name: Zoila Esperanza

texts.es:
Doña Zoila es una señora muy trabajadora de 44 años de edad, casada, y madre de 9 hijos, ella vive con su esposo y tres de sus hijos los cuales se involucran en las actividades del campo y en los quehaceres del hogar. El grado educativo de Doña Zoila es primaria incompleta la cual no pudo terminar por más esfuerzo que hicieron sus padres como ella también ya que desciende de una familia de escasos recursos económicos cursando solamente 4 años. Doña Zoila desde hace 5 años  se dedica a la agricultura junto a su esposo particularmente al cultivo de café ya que esta actividad la aprendió con sus padres que desde niña la llevaban a trabajar (cortar café) a fincas de otras personas para poder sobrevivir. El terreno donde hoy en día tiene sus cultivos de café lo adquirieron con mucho esfuerzo una parte y la otra fue una herencia de parte de sus padres los cuales están ubicados a 1 kilómetros de su casa trasladándose diariamente caminando en compañía de sus hijos y su esposo. 
Ella todas las mañanas junto a su esposo se levantan optimistas y afirman que obtendrán una excelente cosecha de café pero para que eso sea posible ella necesita financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas para dar asistencia técnica a su cultivo de café como ser compra de abono, foliares, fertilizantes entre otros.
Ella sueña hacer crecer sus cultivos mediante la compra de 2 manzanas de tierra más para ser cultivadas y ser una de las mayores productoras de la zona sembrando una plantación nueva de café ya que es la única forma de asegurar el futuro de su familia ya que la situación económica cada día es más difícil.
texts.en:
Zoila, 44, is a very hardworking woman.  Married and the mother of nine children, she lives with her husband and three of her children who work in farming and household activities.  Zoila completed only four years of elementary school despite her parents' efforts because she comes from a low-income family.

Zoila has worked with her husband in agriculture for five years, specifically growing coffee.  She learned this work from her parents when she was little; took her to work picking coffee on other people's farms to be able to survive.

They acquired part of the land where she currently has her crops with a lot of effort; she inherited the other part from her parents.  Her fields are located a kilometer from her house, so she walks there every day with her children and husband.

Every morning Zoila and her husband get out of bed optimistic.  They say they'll have an excellent coffee harvest.  For this to be possible, however, she needs a loan to buy agricultural inputs such as soil amendments, foliar fertilizer, and fertilizer for technical assistance for her coffee crop.

Zoila dreams of buying two additional manzanas of land to expand her crops on a new plantation and of being one of the biggest producers in the region.  Her economic situation is more difficult every day, so this is the only way of securing her family's future.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crop

loans.name: Ravy

texts.en:
Ravy is 49 years old and has two children. Her main sources of income are from selling breakfast and ice cream in a school. She has been involved in this current business for 10 years. 

This is the first loan for Ravy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is applying for an education loan to cover the tuition fees for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree in Finance and Banking. She hopes that her daughter will get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To cover tuition fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for more cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Katooke Saving & Lending Group

texts.en:
Angella is a 29-year-old married woman with four children who  lives in her own house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

She has been operating a retail shop for eight years; she started with capital of 780,000 shillings and now she has capital worth 5,000,000 shillings. She also practices farming to earn additional income. She experiences hardships due to price fluctuation; her dreams are to own a depot of beer and soda, plus educate her children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification.

She is a member of the above mentioned  group where members mobilize savings and guarantee each other to get a loan. 

Angella intends to use the loan to buy beer, soda, sugar, and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda, sugar, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Kheng's Group

texts.en:
Age 54, Kheng is a married father of seven children living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. Out of his seven children, he still has four children who are in school. To support his family, Kheng has been farming rice and working as a paid worker for ten years in the village. The current business earns him about 25,000 KHR per day. 

Kheng’s group consists of three members, and he is the leader of this group. He is a second cycle client with Kiva partner, VisionFund. He has successfully used the past loan from VisionFund to better support his family and business. Now he is leading his group to seek another loan. 

Kheng wants to use his portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farmland. 

He hopes to increase his crop yields, and sell it for a good price to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farmland

loans.name: Wilber

texts.en:
Wilber is a businessman, forty-five years old and a father of three children who are ages 4, 6 and 13, and all in school. He grows trees and sells timber where he works five days a week, giving the business an average of 12 hours per day. He started trading in timber in the year 1999 and has operated this business to date. The business is located in a rural area in the Mitooma district.

He started the business with a mind to make income to supply his family's needs. In addition to the timber business he also has a produce business, which he operates on a small scale, and he says it is a great support to the family since it gives him more income. 

He applied for three million UGX to be able to buy trees for cutting into timber logs (lumber) to sell. He has hopes of expanding the business and of becoming financially stable in the future. 

Wilber’s clients are mainly the timber traders in the same location, and these have supported him to date. His main challenge is the lack of capital, which problem he believes will be solved if the loan of three million is given.

loans.use: To buy timber to sell.

loans.name: Andrica

texts.en:
This is Andrica. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more ingredients to make peanut butter, like peanuts and sugar. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education, in their personal, household, and business expenditures. She also has a variety store and sells rice cakes for additional income. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy more ingredients to make peanut butter, like peanuts and sugar.  

Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Andrica hopes to be more successful in business and dreams of having a happy life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more ingredients in making peanut butter, like peanuts and sugar.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 46 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a retired government employee and is now managing their rice farm. To have a continuous source of income, Lucy engages herself in a retailing business, which is selling grocery items. She sells biscuits, drinks and other basic commodities. 

Lucy wanted to expand the products she sells to her customers. She decided to ask for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy eggs, spices and raw ingredients to sell in the village. She's hoping that through this loan her business will continue to grow progressively.

loans.use: to buy eggs, spices and raw ingredients to sell in her village.

loans.name: Kidindimya Tweyambe Group

texts.en:
John is a 54-year-old man, married with 6 children, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a member of Village bank where each member guarantees the others to get a loan. John has been in a carpentry business for 13 years, and with the income he has been able to build a house and also pay school fees for his children. 

The high cost of timber and inadequate capital to hire enough labor affect his business, since the demand for furniture is overwhelming, while his desire is to own a modern workshop in the town center. 

A good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the University, and also to set up a number of income generating activities to secure the future. John is requesting a loan to buy timber to use. Some of the members did not take the loan but because it's a group policy they appear in the photo to guarantee the others.

loans.use: to buy timber to use.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is an experienced farmer from Krasar village of the Shirak region. He has a large family and lives with his wife, three sons (23, 21 and 20 years old) and two daughters (16 and 4 years old). Samvel's middle son is a labor migrant in Russia; he works there and sends some money to the family to take care of their needs. 

To be able to cover the growing needs of his family, Samvel is engaged in cattle breeding, aviculture, breeding sheep, and cultivating wheat. With the help of his sons, he sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of their income. To get prepared for the winter, Samvel needs to make some investments in his agribusiness. He needs a loan of USD 2000 to purchase forage for the livestock, to buy wheat seeds, to purchase fuel for agricultural machinery, and to make previous credit repayments. Samvel and his big family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be grateful for their help in securing this loan.

loans.use: to purchase forage, wheat seeds, and fuel for agricultural machinery and to make previous credit repayments

loans.name: Aharon

texts.en: Aharon is a young farmer from Jrapi village in the Shirak region. He lives with his mother and grandmother. Despite his young age, Aharon is extensively involved in agribusiness. With the help of his mother, he is engaged in cattle breeding, aviculture, breeding sheep, and cultivating wheat, potatoes, alfalfa, and apples. He sells these agricultural products in the local market, which is the only source of income for the family. To continue running his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Aharon needs a loan of USD 2500 to purchase two steers, three sheep, and wheat seeds and to make previous credit repayments. Aharon and his family members will highly appreciate the lenders' support and will be grateful for their goodwill in helping them to maintain and develop their agribusiness with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and seeds and to make previous credit repayments

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en:
Sophy is 31 years old and married with three dependent children. To make a living, she has been selling grocery items and raising pigs while her husband is a paid worker. The current business earns her family about 70,000KHR per day to feed their children. 

Sophy’s group consists of two members, and she has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for six cycles, and she successfully repaid the loans. The past loans have helped her better support her daughter’s education and relieve her family’s financial burden. 

Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. She will use her portion to buy more grocery items for selling, and use a portion of it to spend on buying piglets and pig feeds. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her children in school and increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for selling.

loans.name: Pency

texts.en:
Pency has managed a retail business for almost 21 years. Sometimes she cooks snacks to sell for additional income. Through her earnings from the business she is able to provide some of her children's educational needs. 

She still needs to develop her business because she wants to earn more income in order to fully support her children's needs. Because of this, Pency is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy beverages, breads, canned goods and many other items. She will do her very best to manage the business well and become more profitable.

loans.use: to buy beverages, breads, canned goods and many other items.

loans.name: Safina Group

texts.en:
Mary is in her early 40s. She is single with two children who are still at school. She has been running a grocery store for one year now. She works from 3.30 pm to 11.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Mary's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to start selling secondhand clothes and to buy more drinks for the grocery. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to buy a TV set, pay school fees, cover household expenses and buy a sofa set. She will use this loan to  restock the missing items in her grocery shop. She dreams of having a big grocery store and another shop for secondhand clothes.

Mary will share this loan with her loan group Safina, which has eleven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to restock the missing items in her grocery shop.

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Ou Reang Ov district where crop farming is a common way to make a living, Yat, 46, is a married mother of four children, two of whom are still in school. The sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and cassava growing. Having been in this business for more than 20 years, Yat is able to earn about US$13 per day to support her family. 
Yat has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now, she is applying as a second-time borrower with VisionFund to pay for her daughter's university fees. She hopes to send and keep her daughter in university and she hopes that her daughter will have a good and bright future from her academic studies and make a better living in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the entire tuition fee for four years for her daughter

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, a new client, is a cattle trader in Rwencence, an area of southwestern Uganda, where he has been for the last 12 years. He works hard in his business and works four days a week. He also has a bar, which is his other source of income. He opens the bar when he is not working in the cattle trade business. 

John started his cattle business in 2001 because he thought it would reward him with big profits, which he would use to uplift the status of his family. He would like to buy more cows to make more profit and better cater to his family's needs. 

John’s clients are mainly Rwandans, who buy the cattle and take them back to Rwanda. He hopes to expand the business and to use his profits to buy a big chunk of land for his family, which will benefit the family in the long run.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Takhmina

texts.en:
Takhmina is a student of the American University of Central Asia, in the department of European Studies. Below is her story. 

“Europe has a high position in the world economy, culture, and science. I have chosen to enroll in AUCA's department of European Studies because I like some habits of European people: for example, time management, choosing a profession, and planning the future. The above listed things are very important in our life; they form our life. If we know how to manage our time and plan actions, we will succeed in many aspects of our life. These rules are used in the developed countries like the USA, European countries, etc. I also like European culture. The culture of the European countries plays a big role in world history, and I want our country to have good relationships with these countries. During my studies at AUCA I would like to get internships in some of Europe's countries. Fortunately the education schedule and system does allow students to take international internships. I would like to mention that this is not the only opportunity that AUCA gives to all of its students. One of them is a Kiva loan. So, I would like to apply for it, so that I will be able to cover my tuition fees.”

loans.use: To pay for higher education costs.

loans.name: Rem

texts.en:
Rem is 53 years old and a mother of five children. She lives in Takeo province and appears in this photo with her husband and daughter who is a freshly graduated high school student this year. Rem cultivates rice on two hectares of farmland and sells her produce in the local markets. With the help of her supportive husband, she is able to make a normal income of USD 6.66 per day. 

Rem is requesting a loan to help her daughter attend a university program in Phnom Penh. She will use the loan to pay the fee for a four-year course. Her daughter’s major is accounting and finance which the most popular subject for female students in Cambodia. Rem said she is a hardworking farmer who earns a living through physical labor and she doesn't want her children to follow her way of hardship. She will try her best to provide opportunities to educate each of her children after their graduation. 

Rem is very happy and thankful for her loan funded via Kiva through its partner HKL to enable poor students to pursue a higher education and contribute to the future development of Cambodia.

loans.use: to pay for four-year-course fees at the university

loans.name: Starlight Group

texts.en:
Charles, who is in his late 30s, is married and has two children who are still going to school.  

He has been running a business of selling charcoal for three years now.  He works from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Charles's eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to open a small shop for fruits and vegetables and to increase on charcoal stock whenever he got a new loan. He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees, buy a TV set and a radio, and pay household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal to resell.  He dreams of opening a cosmetics shop.

Charles will share this loan with his loan group, "Starlight," which has ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Eduesa

texts.en:
Eduesa is married with 1 child. She is 42 years old and lives in Lower Salug Daku, Mahayag Zamboanga Del Sur.

Eduesa runs a sari-sari store (general store) to earn a living and has had this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to restock her sari-sari store with canned goods, bread, soap, soft drinks, and other items.

Eduesa has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, she hopes to provide a good education to her child and to expand her sari-sari store someday.

loans.use: to restock her sari-sari store with canned goods, bread, soap, soft drinks, and other items.

loans.name: Elizabeth Alejandrina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres De Lucha se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Elizabeth, tiene 43 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, dos mayores de edad y tres de 17, 16 y 11 años los tres menores estudian en colegio. El marido es comerciante. 
Ella y su esposo se dedican al comercio, venden artículos para el hogar, ellos se  desplazan a otros lugares a vender ollas, platos, cucharas, y ropa de todo tipo, mientras ella vende por su localidad el esposo se desplaza a ciudades del oriente ecuatoriano ofreciendo sus productos ya que es en esos lugares donde tiene sus mejores clientes, ellos dejan a crédito y cobran cada quince días, llevan más de 15 años dedicados a esta actividad la cual le permite salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ollas, cucharas, planchas y ropa de todo tipo. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener su propio almacén.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres de Lucha [Fighting Women]" communal bank meets every fifteen days in the Picoaza parish of Portoviejo, a place known for being very commercial, for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo Fiestas, and for the joy of its people. 

Here lives Elizabeth, who is 43 and is in a common-law marriage from which she has five children.  Two of the children are older, and the three younger ones, 17, 16, and 11, are in school.  Her husband is a businessman.
